commit_message:
[Gate Fix]Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

This commit also updates Sphinx version in requirement.txt
Also, switch from oslosphinx to openstackdocstheme

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I1d4071d5154f1f24f57b05a46771f9c243bb56b6

commit_message:
zypper-minimal: install without recommends

for setting up the initial chroot the installation without
recommended packages should be enough. This avoids
a conflict between systemd-logger and rsyslog for openSUSE Leap 42

Change-Id: I1b5d646d1f009fc718e1efb9823877ddc261bdda

commit_message:
Clear RequestSpec requested_destination and ignore_hosts in confirm/revert resize.

Confirm/revert resize doesn't clear instance RequestSpec's
requested_destination and ignore_hosts, it will cause the
failure of rebuilding instance after resize. More detail
please check [1].

[1].https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1841904

Change-Id: I800c1c2f3c1c5d34f9f7a2d3cf45172674fe8b07
Closes-Bug: #1841904
Signed-off-by: Fan Zhang <zh.f@outlook.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-10 14:45:09.000000000', 'message': "Add tempest-full job that explicitly uses py37

Our current tempest-full-py3 job runs with Python 3.6. Our highest
required runtime for Train is Python 3.7 though. There are some breaking
changes between 3.6 and 3.7, so it's possible some projects have passing
tests with the current job and think they are fine, but will actually
have issues with the newest version. This adds a test to have something
explicitly using 3.7.

Change-Id: I24b1ec731acdd2234564fab32bd85df0ef254015
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-07-10 14:50:28.000000000', 'message': "Add tempest-full job that explicitly uses py37

Our current tempest-full-py3 job runs with Python 3.6. Our highest
required runtime for Train is Python 3.7 though. There are some breaking
changes between 3.6 and 3.7, so it's possible some projects have passing
tests with the current job and think they are fine, but will actually

Change-Id: I24b1ec731acdd2234564fab32bd85df0ef254015
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add tempest-full job that explicitly uses py37

Our current tempest-full-py3 job runs with Python 3.6. Our highest
required runtime for Train is Python 3.7 though. There are some breaking
changes between 3.6 and 3.7, so it's possible some projects have passing
tests with the current job and think they are fine, but will actually
have issues with the newest version. This adds a test to have something
explicitly using 3.7.

Change-Id: I24b1ec731acdd2234564fab32bd85df0ef254015
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

during iteration, so fixing it by list instead of dict.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-29 10:44:04.000000000', 'message': "Set cinder's my_ip based on SERVICE_IP_VERSION value

Devstack's lib/cinder set the my_ip on cinder side but it
hard-code it with HOST_IP[1]. It is no issue for IPv4 env
but when you build or run the IPv6 job then this ip is left
to set with IPv6. my_ip should be set to HOST_IP or HOST_IPV6
based on SERVICE_IP_VERSION value.

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments',
we will expand the 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' job to do IPv6-only
deployments verification so we need fix the the my_ip setting.

Closes-Bug: #1838250

[1]https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/6aeaceb0c4ef078d028fb6605cac2a37444097d8/lib/cinder#L231

Change-Id: I71c74e46467a5d3c1bf9c7d683f364cba7cf9d80

but when you build or run the IPv6 job then this ip is left
to set with IPv6. my_ip should be set to HOST_IP or HOST_IPV6

commit_message:
Set cinder's my_ip based on SERVICE_IP_VERSION value

Devstack's lib/cinder set the my_ip on cinder side but it
hard-code it with HOST_IP[1]. It is no issue for IPv4 env
but when you build or run the IPv6 job then this ip is left
to set with IPv6. my_ip should be set to HOST_IP or HOST_IPV6
based on SERVICE_IP_VERSION value.

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments',
we will expand the 'devstack-tempest-ipv6' job to do IPv6-only
deployments verification so we need fix the the my_ip setting.

Closes-Bug: #1838250

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677524/

[1]https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/6aeaceb0c4ef078d028fb6605cac2a37444097d8/lib/cinder#L231

Change-Id: I71c74e46467a5d3c1bf9c7d683f364cba7cf9d80

commit_message:
Fix RedHat entry in apache_config_path

With CentOS 7, ansible is expecting to have RedHat as an attribute for
the dict so Discover configurations task fails with an undefined
variable error.

Closes-Bug: #1750573
Change-Id: I5bf9c4057ca9f75d730add9e429d0ef050c6d900
(cherry picked from commit 2e9e90b9a862fee3a47ad211b712171497f13e97)

commit_message:
Allow extra repositories to be added to images

This patch adds option DIB_YUM_MINIMAL_EXTRA_REPOS to yum-minimal to
allow DIB users to include extra repositories to their final image.

Change-Id: I89549f4b0f4c9470143b5064817acab5043e31c5

commit_message:
Remove HostPrepConfig

HostPrepConfig was using the old way (Heat) to run Ansible. We don't
need it anymore thanks to config-download.

It removes some technical debt and reduce our number of interfaces to
configure software.

Change-Id: I2041e6892de76b0ed04d7497e3f9064bfaf58270
(cherry picked from commit efa69b734b2f206008028d75dc7bc083e528fa11)

commit_message:
Adds LibvirtLogOutputs to define how log outputs are sent

LibvrtLogOutputs to define how log outputs are sent,
like file, syslog, and so on.
In default, it is configured so that libvirt directly records
its log into /var/log/containers/libvirt/libvirtd.log .

Change-Id: Iac3d3e9d95c281433cf189c7d277f0a833736ffa

commit_message:
watcher: add systemd units for watcher services

Currently systemd unit for watcher componenets are missing making it
difficult to manage the lifecycle of these services.
So adding these unit files and be installed during installation.

Also a minor tweak to the permission of the service folder under
sysconf dir to enable reading of the service config files for
these processes.

Change-Id: Id35d7e39429bdf13be95d414481ec6eaf7fce874
(cherry picked from commit 0e1f66123ef2a840e2f7b316fbb6c3577e7b72c1)
(cherry picked from commit 9dddf9091bd5667a684b73d83396c7d2f398964c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-31 09:26:44.000000000', 'message': 'Bump the openstackdocstheme extension to 1.20

Some options are now automatically configured by the version 1.20:
- project
- html_last_updated_fmt
- latex_engine
- latex_elements

commit_message:
Set undercloud-connection to local by default

This patch fixes the right default for the 'undercloud-connection' option
according to the help message.

Change-Id: Ib0eb19ddd2968ab328565dec3171f480327be27f

commit_message:
Pass undercloud_connection in TripleoInventory instantiation.

The parameter undercloud_connection is being available as
an input option in the script, however it was not being passed
into the TripleoInventory object instantiation.

Change-Id: Ife819b1d807946c8e53deaacbb8e4f9361009f6e
Closes-Bug: #1832932
(cherry picked from commit b60bc846444cff42abcc8afd913e4cf34fc33524)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-16 05:45:13.000000000', 'message': 'rpm-distro: ensure we selinux relabel underlying directories

As described inline, we need to ensure the underlying directories in
the image are correctly labeled, or we get all manner of services
failing during boot with selinux in enforcing mode.  Although the
problem is generic, this first shows up in Fedora 30 as systemd has
become more strict about namespace failures (I think) [1].

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1663040#c22

Change-Id: I52c1cc719884879169b606b00651aa26f5b783f1
'}]
commit_message:
rpm-distro: ensure we selinux relabel underlying directories

As described inline, we need to ensure the underlying directories in
the image are correctly labeled, or we get all manner of services
failing during boot with selinux in enforcing mode.  Although the
problem is generic, this first shows up in Fedora 30 as systemd has
become more strict about namespace failures (I think) [1].

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1663040#c22

Change-Id: I52c1cc719884879169b606b00651aa26f5b783f1

[{'created': '2019-08-15 05:58:30.000000000', 'message': "yum-minimal: install fedora-release-cloud

Something (possibly [1], but that change is at best cryptic) has
changed such that we don't get correct /etc/os-release files
installed.  This flows on to grub half-installing itself, enough to
not fail the build but not enough to make something bootable.

Installing the -cloud release package gets it back, and seems like a
sane choice for dib.

[1] https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/fedora-release/c/617b1bed348d92cba04443f8cce1486639a114f0

Change-Id: Iff0413887fad798273b2bfcb140cc07f36d54a04
"}]
commit_message:
yum-minimal: install fedora-release-cloud

Something (possibly [1], but that change is at best cryptic) has
changed such that we don't get correct /etc/os-release files
installed.  This flows on to grub half-installing itself, enough to
not fail the build but not enough to make something bootable.

Installing the -cloud release package gets it back, and seems like a
sane choice for dib.

[1] https://src.fedoraproject.org/rpms/fedora-release/c/617b1bed348d92cba04443f8cce1486639a114f0

Change-Id: Iff0413887fad798273b2bfcb140cc07f36d54a04

Hi Harald. I've added the topic of bumping n-lib version in the Neutron Drivers agenda [1]. I can't attend this Friday but boden is aware of that. Maybe you can attend to this meeting. With the n-lib code released, I think this patch is ready to be merged.

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Meetings/NeutronDrivers#Agenda"}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-06-03 23:14:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Workflow-1

There is a policy issue, when not using an admin account listing and getting conntrack helpers fails.

  {
      "NeutronError": {
          "message": "Failed to check policy tenant_id:%(tenant_id)s because Unable to verify match:%(tenant_id)s as the parent resource: tenant was not found.",
          "type": "PolicyCheckError",
          "detail": ""
      }
  }'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-06-05 22:17:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-06-05 22:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

> There is a policy issue, when not using an admin account listing
 > and getting conntrack helpers fails.
 > 
 > {
 > "NeutronError": {
 > "message": "Failed to check policy tenant_id:%(tenant_id)s because
 > Unable to verify match:%(tenant_id)s as the parent resource: tenant
 > was not found.",
 > "type": "PolicyCheckError",
 > "detail": ""
 > }
 > }

Part of the issue was that I had missed updating neutron/conf/policies/__init__.py ... then afict to do policy for parent owner EXT_PARENT_RESOURCE_MAPPING in neutron_lib.services.constants needs additons, ref [1]. This is now blocked until we have a neutron-lib release.


[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/contributor/internals/policy.html#ownercheck-extended-checks-for-resource-ownership'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2019-06-05 23:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/650270/18 : SUCCESS in 1h 58m 05s'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-06-19 18:24:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

neutron-lib 1.27.0 is released and https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663446/ there. Maybe you can remove the temporary modules implemented here.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2019-06-24 11:05:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18: Workflow-1

> neutron-lib 1.27.0 is released and https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663446/

commit_message:
Conntrack Helper - Plugin

Implements Conntrack Helper service plugin for conntrack
helper resources. Supports create, update and delete
conntrack helper for l3 routers.

A new configuration option:
  [l3-conntrack-helpers]/allowed_conntrack_helpers
introduced to allow the operator to configure CT
helpers, and the helper protocol constraints.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-22 06:57:01.000000000', 'message': "Check for agent restarted after checking for DVR port

Commit a5244d6d44d2b66de27dc77efa7830fa657260be changed the check
order so regular non-dvr ports are checked for agent restarted.
However regular ports may be unbound already, which leads to the
error in the bug description: agent_restarted check is done against
a 'None' agent.
This patch fixed logic back - only check agent_restarted for dvr ports.

This also adds some logging to have a clue why update port up/down fails.

Change-Id: I3ad59864eeb42916d2cf15a5292d5aa9484f6e91
Closes-Bug: #1835731

commit_message:
Check for agent restarted after checking for DVR port

This is a stable-only fix since code around the change was removed 
in master: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/641866

Commit a5244d6d44d2b66de27dc77efa7830fa657260be changed the check
order so regular non-dvr ports are checked for agent restarted.
However regular ports may be unbound already, which leads to the
error in the bug description: agent_restarted check is done against
a 'None' agent.
This patch fixed logic back - only check agent_restarted for dvr ports.

This also adds some logging to have a clue why update port up/down fails.

Change-Id: I3ad59864eeb42916d2cf15a5292d5aa9484f6e91
Closes-Bug: #1835731
(cherry picked from commit c3a3031f78b3ea2d16d4eb08b181916dbc6f4c45)

a non-existant plan, return a useful message instead.

commit_message:
Only install monotonic on python2

monotonic is a backport of time.monotonic from python3. Only install it
for python2.

commit_message:
Clean routers in DvrRoutersNegativeTestExtended

It completes the initial patch "Add tempest tests for DVR router state
management" which doesn't clean 2 routers [1].

Add group-based-policy to blacklist

This commit adds x/group-based-policy plugin to the blacklist. It looks
this plugin doesn't support python3 yet.

commit_message:
Implement system admin for policy association

This change modifies the policies for policy
association API to be more self-service by properly
checking for system scopes. It also includes the test cases.

Subsequent patches will -

 - add domains user test coverage for policy association
 - add project user test coverage for policy association
 - Removing obsolete policies in policy.v3cloudsample.json file
Partial-Bug: #1805409

Change-Id: I7ed54a378dc20680cd987142c71afc36cb1dbd25

commit_message:
Implement system reader & member for policy association

This change modifies the policies for policy association
API to be more self-service by properly checking for
system scopes. It also includes the test cases.

Subsequent patches will -

 - add functionality for system admin for policy association
 - domains user test coverage for policy association
 - project user test coverage for policy association
 - Removing obsolete policies in policy.v3cloudsample.json file

Change-Id: I0b6ddc961d65301b4b95b0ba1c2515ef4a782d55
Partial-Bug: #1805409

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

commit_message:
Fail correctly if can't create output files

This patch makes the containers image prepare
command fails correctly if the output file can't be
created properly.

Closes-Bug: 1786204
Change-Id: I7187a521f850050c2bc30fee4f86284e5c6ec05d

commit_message:
Restore docker variabes in ceph-base

Since ceph-ansible doesn't support yet the container
generic variables already merged here, this change
restores the docker registry/image_tag/container values
to pull the right container from the registry.
This change can be reverted when the ceph-ansible PR
will be merged.

ceph-ansible PR: https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible/pull/4002

Change-Id: I5185371e92e7ea10489c7abfa89a24b12d67220b

commit_message:
Add support for an user admin can see details any cluster, profile

In currently, i can't get/find details of cluster with user have role is admin.
I want I can do this for something my developing such as monitors a cluster, ...
Thanks

Change-Id: I9a42cf52fdbc8baac4ca2646cb2bdec0f0237190
Closes-Bug: #1823188

commit_message:
Avoid pollution and false positives with tox.ini

- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

- add missing zuul.yaml to configure check/gate tests.

Change-Id: I60a7b5163c311ba929e8b44d2ff022bb75423b3c

commit_message:
Fix NovaEnableRbdBackend to be role specific

This [1] change enabled to have role specific NovaEnableRbdBackend
parameter, however global parameter were allways overriding role
specific hiera after it was set via RoleParametersValue

[1]: I9f40a2a3561fcb1d1fec9d9c3c1f9cabaf02650c

Change-Id: Iab58223a6140e42028d4d2a7305c05fd7ae3a9f0

commit_message:
Update tox.ini for Python 3 Train unit test goal

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train. This particular patch is
just limiting the tox envlist to py37 to enable efficient use of 'tox'.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Change-Id: I323112d05e998d682c12de45f099536c62552a41
Story: #2005924
Task: #34254

commit_message:
Fix cell_v2 discover_hosts when Ironic enabled

When Ironic used the 'cell_v2 discover_hosts' should be executed
with '--by-service' option, otherwise the hosts doesn't discoverd.

Change-Id: I213be691187b261523c2d3b1c51b2da8a50b412a
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 8af53d4f9b3ded4bd5ab4b57088cb57f339d9732)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-21 11:52:58.000000000', 'message': 'Split fake host capabilities into reusable variables

fakelibvirt.Connection.getCapabilities() spoofs a response to the
libvirt getCapabilities API call by hardcoding a large XML response
within itself.  Split this XML response into smaller fragments and
move them to separate variables within the recently introduced
fake_libvirt_data class so that other tests (in particular an imminent
patch for the benefit of SEV and Secure Boot which tracks libvirt
host/domain capabilities for multiple machine types) can reuse them
individually.

This has some side benefits on readability: it makes much easier to
see the overall structure of the fake <capabilities> element at a
single glance without having to scroll through pages of XML, it avoids
bloating code by mixing in large chunks of static data, and it also
places the fake capabilities data next to the fake domain capabilities
data, which is useful given the relationships between the two.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I08f9069a7735bf3a705e6bedf9defad58b9ac7e8
'}, {'created': '2019-08-21 12:36:38.000000000', 'message': 'Split fake host capabilities into reusable variables

fakelibvirt.Connection.getCapabilities() spoofs a response to the
libvirt getCapabilities API call by hardcoding a large XML response
within itself.  Split this XML response into smaller fragments and
move them to separate variables within the recently introduced
fake_libvirt_data class so that other tests (in particular an imminent
patch for the benefit of SEV and Secure Boot which tracks libvirt
host/domain capabilities for multiple machine types) can reuse them
individually.

This has some side benefits on readability: it makes much easier to
see the overall structure of the fake <capabilities> element at a
single glance without having to scroll through pages of XML, it avoids
bloating code by mixing in large chunks of static data, and it also
places the fake capabilities data next to the fake domain capabilities
data, which is useful given the relationships between the two.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I08f9069a7735bf3a705e6bedf9defad58b9ac7e8
'}]
commit_message:
Split fake host capabilities into reusable variables

fakelibvirt.Connection.getCapabilities() spoofs a response to the
libvirt getCapabilities API call by hardcoding a large XML response
within itself.  Split this XML response into smaller fragments and
move them to separate variables within the recently introduced
fake_libvirt_data class so that other tests (in particular an imminent
patch for the benefit of SEV and Secure Boot which tracks libvirt
host/domain capabilities for multiple machine types) can reuse them
individually.

This has some side benefits on readability: it makes much easier to
see the overall structure of the fake <capabilities> element at a
single glance without having to scroll through pages of XML, it avoids
bloating code by mixing in large chunks of static data, and it also
places the fake capabilities data next to the fake domain capabilities
data, which is useful given the relationships between the two.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I08f9069a7735bf3a705e6bedf9defad58b9ac7e8

commit_message:
mke2fs: do not use full path

At the moment, tempest assumes that mke2fs will reside at /usr/sbin.
This is not necessarily true, for which reason it's safer to just
avoid using the full path.

Change-Id: I6455bbc2e5cec14d2520b19fc00d183d02879e4b

[{'created': '2019-08-27 17:01:57.000000000', 'message': 'OpenSuse: Cleanup script define packages to remove as string

This PS updates the SuSE cleanup script to define the virtual env
package to remove as a string, reather than as an array. An alternative
would have been to reference this via `${remove_packages[@]}` but as
this contains a singular value, and is not used anywhere else, it seems
simpler just to use a plain string here.

Change-Id: If559a710e4ec1f4ffc4528ecff58390c30a5351e
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>
'}]
commit_message:
OpenSuse: Cleanup script define packages to remove as string

This PS updates the SuSE cleanup script to define the virtual env
package to remove as a string, reather than as an array. An alternative
would have been to reference this via `${remove_packages[@]}` but as
this contains a singular value, and is not used anywhere else, it seems
simpler just to use a plain string here.

Change-Id: If559a710e4ec1f4ffc4528ecff58390c30a5351e
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Note that python35-charm-jobs is retained since this charm is supported
on Xenial.

Change-Id: I07367d25966bd9e0b5103a7e628ba16d5a1712f8
Story: #2005924
Task: #34228

[{'created': '2019-08-29 01:09:51.000000000', 'message': 'Clear net.ifnames definition

With RHEL8, net.ifnames is set to 0 in the grub config. This is a change
in the default image which can have user impacts. We want to clear it to
go back to the previously defined behavior in RHEL7.

Closes-Bug: #1841441
(cherry picked from commit 8da8d9a51b287d520c465fae254262fc4286e92e)

commit_message:
Clear net.ifnames definition

With RHEL8, net.ifnames is set to 0 in the grub config. This is a change
in the default image which can have user impacts. We want to clear it to
go back to the previously defined behavior in RHEL7.

Change-Id: I621066ea5e0e934668ff4c91e991a95d18e019f7
Closes-Bug: #1841441
(cherry picked from commit 8da8d9a51b287d520c465fae254262fc4286e92e)

commit_message:
Remove openSUSE 42.3 job

openSUSE 42.3 is dead, remove the job, we test with openSUSE 15 now (as
on master). This allows to remove the nodes from CI.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/677947
Change-Id: I1de9f2d0bb4bdad0b5fcaf1bd91864a9bc7f6a8a

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-27 21:05:23.000000000', 'message': 'Expand scope of collectd address prefix in metrics-qdr

While working on multi-cloud metrics support, we want to use addresses such as
"collectd/cloud2-telemetry" and "collectd/cloud2-notify". Rather than requiring
that this configuration match what users set up in collectd, this change
configures the entire "collectd" prefix to be multicast.

Since the current config covers all collectd messages anyways ("notify" and
"telemetry" are the only two instances it writes to), this change has no
immediate effect and is backwards compatible.

Change-Id: Iddfc29215ef0eace7c488e92400ce5bb2806dbab
'}]
commit_message:
Expand scope of collectd address prefix in metrics-qdr

While working on multi-cloud metrics support, we want to use addresses such as
"collectd/cloud2-telemetry" and "collectd/cloud2-notify". Rather than requiring
that this configuration match what users set up in collectd, this change
configures the entire "collectd" prefix to be multicast.

Since the current config covers all collectd messages anyways ("notify" and
"telemetry" are the only two instances it writes to), this change has no
immediate effect and is backwards compatible.

Change-Id: Iddfc29215ef0eace7c488e92400ce5bb2806dbab

commit_message:
Use /var/tmp on host to store temporal files for image upload via Horizon

Previously we use /tmp inside horizon container to store temporal files
for image upload via Horizon, but this makes the image size grow for
each upload operation.

This patch makes sure that we use host directory to store temporal
file, so that it is not written inside container.

Conflicts:
        deployment/horizon/horizon-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: Ic32e7a2db83bb5a0fb3c69708be9be96435dd030

commit_message:
Fix NovaEnableRbdBackend to be role specific

This [1] change enabled to have role specific NovaEnableRbdBackend
parameter, however global parameter were allways overriding role
specific hiera after it was set via RoleParametersValue

[1]: I9f40a2a3561fcb1d1fec9d9c3c1f9cabaf02650c

Change-Id: Iab58223a6140e42028d4d2a7305c05fd7ae3a9f0
(cherry picked from commit eb5251ad9ff37f203eccdeba896b8386df1cb082)
(cherry picked from commit 0febc015d8b73c8b7f807d6b563851c2f64f494f)

commit_message:
Use /var/tmp on host to store temporal files for image upload via Horizon

Previously we use /tmp inside horizon container to store temporal files
for image upload via Horizon, but this makes the image size grow for
each upload operation.

This patch makes sure that we use host directory to store temporal
file, so that it is not written inside container.

Conflicts:
        deployment/horizon/horizon-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: Ic32e7a2db83bb5a0fb3c69708be9be96435dd030
Closes-Bug: 1840607
(cherry picked from commit a75cc9a9539bc8d6367f5771325914f15593e422)
(cherry picked from commit 12ad0d83a4fbb1a6de92750dba1bae8dbd4bf22a)

commit_message:
Use /var/tmp on host to store temporal files for image upload via Horizon

Previously we use /tmp inside horizon container to store temporal files
for image upload via Horizon, but this makes the image size grow for
each upload operation.

This patch makes sure that we use host directory to store temporal
file, so that it is not written inside container.

Conflicts:
        deployment/horizon/horizon-container-puppet.yaml

Change-Id: Ic32e7a2db83bb5a0fb3c69708be9be96435dd030
Closes-Bug: 1840607
(cherry picked from commit a75cc9a9539bc8d6367f5771325914f15593e422)

commit_message:
only disable mac ageing for ovs hybrid plug

The mac ageing configuration on linux bridges is now
conditional and caller controlled. By default mac ageing
is unspecified and will use the kernel's default of 300
seconds. For ovs with hybrid plug we override this to
0 to prevent packet loss issue during some migration
edgecases. This change reverts disabling mac ageing
for the linux bridge plugin which was accidentally
introduced during the brctl removal via inheriting the
ovs plugin's default behavior when the bridge create
code became shared.

Backport Changes:
  In the train cycle we removed the os_vif.internal.command
  module in Id8b71172fb06b435cf169a7e55c11233f22fa65b to eliminate
  one layer of indirection. As a result we need to addtionally
  update the add method in os_vif/internal/command/ip/__init__.py
  which was not required in the train patch.

Change-Id: I95612352de6cdb47de98eb80c208dd1a74499d41
Closes-bug: #1837252
(cherry picked from commit 655c83d706f5de8a8cf23430782e065219297aef)

[{'created': '2019-07-11 09:52:26.000000000', 'message': "Creates boot entry and loads OS for UEFI systems for wholedisk images

In case of Pure UEFI systems or the systems with multiple disks,
it doesn't know what is the default disk and in which disk the image
is written by Ironic. In such cases the OS doesnot boot. But we know
into which disk Ironic has written the image and  i am find the partuuid
of the EFI partition on that disk and creating the boot entry using
'efibootmgr' command and thus the OS is loaded in UEFI systems, when
we provision wholedisk images and boot option as local.

commit_message:
Creates boot entry on bare metal in UEFI boot mode for wholedisk images

In case of UEFI only systems or the systems with multiple disks,
system is not aware of default disk or the disk where image was written.
In such cases the OS doesnot boot. This can be resolved by creating boot
entry on the system using partuuid of the EFI partition with the help of
'efibootmgr' command, when we provision wholedisk images and boot option
as local.

Depends-On: I02a1c033d2fa1fdf063594efc7977cfdbe05fb6a
Change-Id: Iebfb283fc80a33f673adb05ae34ff0c3a5b3300e
Story: 2005533
Task: 30663

commit_message:
Fix python3 compatibility on LDAP search DN from id

In Python 3, python-ldap no longer allows bytes for some fields (DNs,
RDNs, attribute names, queries). Instead, text values are represented
as str, the Unicode text type.

[1] More details about byte/str usage in python-ldap can be found at:
http://www.python-ldap.org/en/latest/bytes_mode.html#bytes-mode

Change-Id: I63e3715032cd8edb11fbff7651f5ba1af506dc9d
Related-Bug: #1798184
(cherry picked from commit 03531a56910b12922afde32b40e270b7d68a334b)

[{'created': '2019-07-23 20:05:31.000000000', 'message': "Fixing dn_to_id function for cases were id is not in the DN

The more common scenario to return the uid as part of the RDN in a DN,
However, it's a valid case to not have the uid in the RDN, so we need to
search in the LDAP based on the DN and return the uid in the entire object.

Also, we do not support multivalued attribute id on DN, so the test case
covering this case, it was adjusted for raise NotFound.

Closes-Bug: 1782922
Change-Id: I87a3bfa94b5907ce4c6b4eb8e124ec948b390bf2
(cherry picked from commit a1dc21f3d34ae34bc6a5c9acebc0eb752495ae7a)

commit_message:
Fixing dn_to_id function for cases were id is not in the DN

The more common scenario to return the uid as part of the RDN in a DN,
However, it's a valid case to not have the uid in the RDN, so we need to
search in the LDAP based on the DN and return the uid in the entire object.

Also, we do not support multivalued attribute id on DN, so the test case
covering this case, it was adjusted for raise NotFound.

Closes-Bug: 1782922
Change-Id: I87a3bfa94b5907ce4c6b4eb8e124ec948b390bf2
(cherry picked from commit a1dc21f3d34ae34bc6a5c9acebc0eb752495ae7a)

[{'created': '2019-08-27 18:26:48.000000000', 'message': "Fix NFS volume retype with migrate

When migrating a volume to an NFS backend, don't rename the associated
volume file if the original source volume was on the same backend (same
provider_location). Volume migration always deletes the source volume,
so the volume file should *not* be renamed to the original.

Closes-Bug: #1798468
Change-Id: Iadf537521af93bbd28452a54e0e70e7ed18f606c
(cherry picked from commit 33a3a4bf6fe72b093702922e2e5f102d06249375)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix NFS volume retype with migrate

When migrating a volume to an NFS backend, don't rename the associated
volume file if the original source volume was on the same backend (same
provider_location). Volume migration always deletes the source volume,
so the volume file should *not* be renamed to the original.

Closes-Bug: #1798468
Change-Id: Iadf537521af93bbd28452a54e0e70e7ed18f606c
(cherry picked from commit 33a3a4bf6fe72b093702922e2e5f102d06249375)

commit_message:
Fix python3 compatibility on LDAP search DN from id

In Python 3, python-ldap no longer allows bytes for some fields (DNs,
RDNs, attribute names, queries). Instead, text values are represented
as str, the Unicode text type.

[1] More details about byte/str usage in python-ldap can be found at:
http://www.python-ldap.org/en/latest/bytes_mode.html#bytes-mode

Change-Id: I63e3715032cd8edb11fbff7651f5ba1af506dc9d
Related-Bug: #1798184
(cherry picked from commit 03531a56910b12922afde32b40e270b7d68a334b)

commit_message:
Fixing dn_to_id function for cases were id is not in the DN

The more common scenario to return the uid as part of the RDN in a DN,
However, it's a valid case to not have the uid in the RDN, so we need to
search in the LDAP based on the DN and return the uid in the entire object.

Also, we do not support multivalued attribute id on DN, so the test case
covering this case, it was adjusted for raise NotFound.

Closes-Bug: 1782922
Change-Id: I87a3bfa94b5907ce4c6b4eb8e124ec948b390bf2
(cherry picked from commit a1dc21f3d34ae34bc6a5c9acebc0eb752495ae7a)

[{'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-08-21 10:41:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2019-08-22 01:29:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Abhishek, thanks a lot'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-08-22 03:57:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Review-Priority+2'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-08-22 03:57:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Blocking manila jobs, https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/builds?job_name=manila-tempest-dsvm-postgres-zfsonlinux'}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2019-08-27 09:23:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This also block aodh's gate, please help review, thanks"}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2019-08-28 05:25:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is blocking neutron tips jobs as well,
http://zuul.openstack.org/builds?project=openstack%2Fneutron&job_name=neutron-tempest-postgres-full&branch=master'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-08-28 11:47:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-08-29 14:50:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

This looks good.  The only weird thing I noticed is that in postgres, POSITION is not case-sensitive, where REPLACE is.  So you could have a situation where has_migrations keeps reporting True, but nothing gets migrated.  But since JSON is case-sensitive, and that's what's being stored in the meta_data, I don't think this is a problem."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-21 10:41:56.000000000', 'message': "Fix INSTR not supported for postgresql

Migration script 'train_migrate01_backend_to_store.py' doesn't support
INSTR function for postgresql database. INSTR function does support
sqlite3 and mysql.

Used 'POSITION' function instead of 'INSTR' function if database is
postgresql.
Closes-Bug: #1840898

Change-Id: I62c592f0885927b873ed35a1efe4a0f8407e7dee
"}]
commit_message:
Fix INSTR not supported for postgresql

Migration script 'train_migrate01_backend_to_store.py' doesn't support
INSTR function for postgresql database. INSTR function does support
sqlite3 and mysql.

Used 'POSITION' function instead of 'INSTR' function if database is
postgresql.
Closes-Bug: #1840898

Change-Id: I62c592f0885927b873ed35a1efe4a0f8407e7dee

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Train San REST Port Removal

The PowerMax Cinder driver has removed the environment
configuration option san_rest_port in favour of the Cinder
standard option san_api_port after 2 release deprecation
period.

Change-Id: Ia47a953c56e7b41841d5da4acb66d79cdfe1384e

subject: Restore soft-deleted compute node with same uuid

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-14 20:19:16.000000000', 'message': "Restore soft-deleted compute node with same uuid

There is a unique index on the compute_nodes.uuid column which
means we can't have more than one compute_nodes record in the
same DB with the same UUID even if one is soft deleted because
the deleted column is not part of that unique index constraint.

This is a problem with ironic nodes where the node is 1:1 with
the compute node record, and when a node is undergoing maintenance
the driver doesn't return it from get_available_nodes() so the
ComputeManager.update_available_resource periodic task (soft)
deletes the compute node record, but when the node is no longer
under maintenance in ironic and the driver reports it, the
ResourceTracker._init_compute_node code will fail to create the
ComputeNode record again because of the duplicate uuid.

This change handles the DBDuplicateEntry error in compute_node_create
by finding the soft-deleted compute node with the same uuid and
simply updating it to no longer be (soft) deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1839560

Change-Id: Iafba419fe86446ffe636721f523fb619f8f787b3
(cherry picked from commit 8b007266f438ec0a5a797d05731cce6f2b155f4c)
(cherry picked from commit aa21f87040cf688b7093ff6d96797ea5c3c6fafd)
"}, {'created': '2019-08-15 16:43:22.000000000', 'message': "Restore soft-deleted compute node with same uuid

There is a unique index on the compute_nodes.uuid column which
means we can't have more than one compute_nodes record in the
same DB with the same UUID even if one is soft deleted because
the deleted column is not part of that unique index constraint.

This is a problem with ironic nodes where the node is 1:1 with
the compute node record, and when a node is undergoing maintenance
the driver doesn't return it from get_available_nodes() so the
ComputeManager.update_available_resource periodic task (soft)
deletes the compute node record, but when the node is no longer
under maintenance in ironic and the driver reports it, the
ResourceTracker._init_compute_node code will fail to create the
ComputeNode record again because of the duplicate uuid.

This change handles the DBDuplicateEntry error in compute_node_create
by finding the soft-deleted compute node with the same uuid and
simply updating it to no longer be (soft) deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1839560

Change-Id: Iafba419fe86446ffe636721f523fb619f8f787b3
(cherry picked from commit 8b007266f438ec0a5a797d05731cce6f2b155f4c)
(cherry picked from commit 1b021665281b74c865d3571fc90772b52d70e467)
"}]
commit_message:
Restore soft-deleted compute node with same uuid

There is a unique index on the compute_nodes.uuid column which
means we can't have more than one compute_nodes record in the
same DB with the same UUID even if one is soft deleted because
the deleted column is not part of that unique index constraint.

This is a problem with ironic nodes where the node is 1:1 with
the compute node record, and when a node is undergoing maintenance
the driver doesn't return it from get_available_nodes() so the
ComputeManager.update_available_resource periodic task (soft)
deletes the compute node record, but when the node is no longer
under maintenance in ironic and the driver reports it, the
ResourceTracker._init_compute_node code will fail to create the
ComputeNode record again because of the duplicate uuid.

This change handles the DBDuplicateEntry error in compute_node_create
by finding the soft-deleted compute node with the same uuid and
simply updating it to no longer be (soft) deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1839560

Change-Id: Iafba419fe86446ffe636721f523fb619f8f787b3
(cherry picked from commit 8b007266f438ec0a5a797d05731cce6f2b155f4c)
(cherry picked from commit 1b021665281b74c865d3571fc90772b52d70e467)

[{'created': '2019-08-27 02:04:29.000000000', 'message': 'Use create_image_from_server to create image for server

This is to use create_image_from_server to create a server image
with multibyte character image name, for the following reasons:
1. deleting image without waiting for it to be active has the potential
   risk of encounting Conflict exception, like
       {u\'message\': u"Cannot 'delete' instance 16d8c500-cd69-4246-964a-39173d451991
                       while it is in task_state image_snapshot",
        u\'code\': 409}
2. using create_image_from_server will make code look cleaner.

Change-Id: Ie9f90f6a151326714067c201a0baebbffc2814d2
'}]
commit_message:
Use create_image_from_server to create image for server

This is to use create_image_from_server to create a server image
with multibyte character image name, for the following reasons:
1. deleting image without waiting for it to be active has the potential
   risk of encounting Conflict exception, like
       {u\'message\': u"Cannot 'delete' instance 16d8c500-cd69-4246-964a-39173d451991
                       while it is in task_state image_snapshot",
        u\'code\': 409}
2. using create_image_from_server will make code look cleaner.

Change-Id: Ie9f90f6a151326714067c201a0baebbffc2814d2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-14 20:16:20.000000000', 'message': "Add functional regression recreate test for bug 1839560

This adds a functional test which recreates bug 1839560
where the driver reports a node, then no longer reports
it so the compute manager deletes it, and then the driver
reports it again later (this can be common with ironic
nodes as they undergo maintenance). The issue is that since
Ia69fabce8e7fd7de101e291fe133c6f5f5f7056a in Rocky, the
ironic node uuid is re-used for the compute node uuid but
there is a unique constraint on the compute node uuid so
when trying to create the compute node once the ironic node
is available again, the compute node create fails with a
duplicate entry error due to the duplicate uuid. To recreate
this in the functional test, a new fake virt driver is added
which provides a predictable uuid per node like the ironic
driver. The test also shows that archiving the database is
a way to workaround the bug until it's properly fixed.

NOTE(mriedem): Since change Idaed39629095f86d24a54334c699a26c218c6593
is not in Rocky the PlacementFixture still comes from nova_fixtures.

Change-Id: If822509e906d5094f13a8700b2b9ed3c40580431
Related-Bug: #1839560
(cherry picked from commit 89dd74ac7f1028daadf86cb18948e27fe9d1d411)
(cherry picked from commit b131bb8bccbcaa6107eaf778ecfd0b35b15e67af)

NOTE(mriedem): Since change Idaed39629095f86d24a54334c699a26c218c6593

commit_message:
Add functional regression recreate test for bug 1839560

This adds a functional test which recreates bug 1839560
where the driver reports a node, then no longer reports
it so the compute manager deletes it, and then the driver
reports it again later (this can be common with ironic
nodes as they undergo maintenance). The issue is that since
Ia69fabce8e7fd7de101e291fe133c6f5f5f7056a in Rocky, the
ironic node uuid is re-used for the compute node uuid but
there is a unique constraint on the compute node uuid so
when trying to create the compute node once the ironic node
is available again, the compute node create fails with a
duplicate entry error due to the duplicate uuid. To recreate
this in the functional test, a new fake virt driver is added
which provides a predictable uuid per node like the ironic
driver. The test also shows that archiving the database is
a way to workaround the bug until it's properly fixed.

NOTE(mriedem): Since change Idaed39629095f86d24a54334c699a26c218c6593
is not in Rocky the PlacementFixture still comes from nova_fixtures.

Change-Id: If822509e906d5094f13a8700b2b9ed3c40580431
Related-Bug: #1839560
(cherry picked from commit 89dd74ac7f1028daadf86cb18948e27fe9d1d411)
(cherry picked from commit e7109d43d6d6db0f9db18976585f3334d2be72bf)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-13 21:09:30.000000000', 'message': 'rt: only map compute node if we created it

If ComputeNode.create() fails, the update_available_resource
periodic will not try to create it again because it will be
mapped in the compute_nodes dict and _init_compute_node will
return early but trying to save changes to that ComputeNode
object later will fail because there is no id on the object,
since we failed to create it in the DB.

This simply reverses the logic such that we only map the
compute node if we successfully created it.

Some existing _init_compute_node testing had to be changed
since it relied on the order of when the ComputeNode object
is created and put into the compute_nodes dict in order
to pass the object along to some much lower-level PCI
tracker code, which was arguably mocking too deep for a unit
test. That is changed to avoid the low-level mocking and
assertions and just assert that _setup_pci_tracker is called
as expected.

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/resource_tracker.py
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py

NOTE(mriedem): The resource_tracker.py conflict is due to
not having I14a310b20bd9892e7b34464e6baad49bf5928ece in Rocky.
The test conflicts are due to not having change
I37e8ad5b14262d801702411c2c87e73550adda70 in Rocky.

Change-Id: I9fa1d509a3de405d6246fb8670612c65c10cc93b
Closes-Bug: #1839674
(cherry picked from commit f578146f372386e1889561cba33e95495e66ce97)
(cherry picked from commit 648770bd6897aa2ec95df3ec55344d5803543f07)
'}]
commit_message:
rt: only map compute node if we created it

If ComputeNode.create() fails, the update_available_resource
periodic will not try to create it again because it will be
mapped in the compute_nodes dict and _init_compute_node will
return early but trying to save changes to that ComputeNode
object later will fail because there is no id on the object,
since we failed to create it in the DB.

This simply reverses the logic such that we only map the
compute node if we successfully created it.

Some existing _init_compute_node testing had to be changed
since it relied on the order of when the ComputeNode object
is created and put into the compute_nodes dict in order
to pass the object along to some much lower-level PCI
tracker code, which was arguably mocking too deep for a unit
test. That is changed to avoid the low-level mocking and
assertions and just assert that _setup_pci_tracker is called
as expected.

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/resource_tracker.py
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py

NOTE(mriedem): The resource_tracker.py conflict is due to
not having I14a310b20bd9892e7b34464e6baad49bf5928ece in Rocky.
The test conflicts are due to not having change
I37e8ad5b14262d801702411c2c87e73550adda70 in Rocky.

Change-Id: I9fa1d509a3de405d6246fb8670612c65c10cc93b
Closes-Bug: #1839674
(cherry picked from commit f578146f372386e1889561cba33e95495e66ce97)
(cherry picked from commit 648770bd6897aa2ec95df3ec55344d5803543f07)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-26 17:41:40.000000000', 'message': '(postgres) Add override for termination period

- Allow configuration of the termination grace period
  for the Patroni pod with a default of 180s to ensure
  the database has time to gracefully spin down, even
  on slow disk.

Change-Id: I420cbd601bbffa50217b717bd4a636d48d324617
'}]
commit_message:
(postgres) Add override for termination period

- Allow configuration of the termination grace period
  for the Patroni pod with a default of 180s to ensure
  the database has time to gracefully spin down, even
  on slow disk.

Change-Id: I420cbd601bbffa50217b717bd4a636d48d324617

The LB creation and kuryr annotation is requiring more
time to finish. This commit increases their timeout.

commit_message:
Add the undercloud backup ansible playbook

This playbook reflects the same behaviour as the mistral workbook
of the same name.
It adds the functionality discussed on this external bug
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1659888

Change-Id: Icf964c23745941dd596f65e2b0bfa81e515508d0

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-23 23:02:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ipv6 support for devstack

Change-Id: I8f469e732618732f5417c1b5e6c2049eaa83ea78
'}, {'created': '2019-08-23 23:06:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ipv6 support for devstack

The problem is that when connecting directly to
a socket. You cannot always use ipv6 addresses
wrapped in brackets e.g. [::1].

As a work around for this, we make sure of HOST_IP,
as it does not wrap the IPv6 address with brackets.

Change-Id: I8f469e732618732f5417c1b5e6c2049eaa83ea78
'}, {'created': '2019-08-23 23:36:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ipv6 support for devstack

as it does not wrap the IPv6 address with brackets.

Change-Id: I8f469e732618732f5417c1b5e6c2049eaa83ea78

Change-Id: I8f469e732618732f5417c1b5e6c2049eaa83ea78
'}, {'created': '2019-08-24 17:46:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ipv6 bugs with devstack and pdns4 driver

The problem is that when connecting directly to
a socket. You cannot always use ipv6 addresses
wrapped in brackets e.g. [::1].

As a work around for this, we make use of HOST_IPV6,
as it does not wrap the IPv6 address with brackets.

We also fix a bug in the pdns4 driver that prevented
it from working properly in a full ipv6 setup.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678324/
Change-Id: I8f469e732618732f5417c1b5e6c2049eaa83ea78
'}, {'created': '2019-08-24 19:08:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ipv6 bugs with devstack and pdns4 driver

The problem is that when connecting directly to
a socket. You cannot always use ipv6 addresses
wrapped in brackets e.g. [::1].

As a work around for this, we make use of HOST_IPV6,
as it does not wrap the IPv6 address with brackets.

We also fix a bug in the pdns4 driver that prevented
it from working properly in a full ipv6 setup.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678318/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678324/
Change-Id: I8f469e732618732f5417c1b5e6c2049eaa83ea78
'}, {'created': '2019-08-25 01:43:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ipv6 bugs with devstack and pdns4 driver

* Change dns backends and pools.yaml to use
  ipv6 addresses not wrapped in brackets.

  We make use of HOST_IP/HOST_IPV6 to achieve
  this.

* Changed MySQL backends to use MYSQL_HOST.

* Fixed bug in pdns4 driver not allowing
  masters to use an ipv6 address.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678324/
Change-Id: I8f469e732618732f5417c1b5e6c2049eaa83ea78
'}, {'created': '2019-08-26 02:43:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ipv6 bugs with devstack and pdns4 driver

  We make use of HOST_IP/HOST_IPV6 to achieve
  this.

* Changed MySQL backends to use MYSQL_HOST.

* Fixed bug in pdns4 driver not allowing
  masters to use an ipv6 address.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678324/
Change-Id: I8f469e732618732f5417c1b5e6c2049eaa83ea78

commit_message:
Fix ipv6 bugs with devstack and pdns4 driver

* Change dns backends and pools.yaml to use
  ipv6 addresses not wrapped in brackets.

* Changed MySQL backends to use MYSQL_HOST.

* Fixed bug in pdns4 driver not allowing
  masters to use an ipv6 address.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678324/
Change-Id: I8f469e732618732f5417c1b5e6c2049eaa83ea78

subject: Update port_status to ACTIVE during live-migration
messages: [{'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-08-21 10:55:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-08-26 19:17:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-08-29 13:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-21 10:55:24.000000000', 'message': "Update port_status to ACTIVE during live-migration

During live-migration nova waits for 'network-vif-plugged' event
in order to proceeed with live-migration [1]. While using OVN
it never happened because the original design assumes usage
of neutron agents.

This patch updates port status from DOWN to ACTIVE during
pre_live_migration state, which in fact for Neutron/ML2
is done by neutron-ovs-agent, just only to emit
'network-vif-plugged' notification and allow nova
to perform live-migration.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/558001/

Change-Id: Ib9fe6e1bfea1d5f62b2f2b6fdb12d16878108c3f
Related-Bug: 1834045
(cherry picked from commit 229f894ee6aff6b5da8cc399575537feed1c6a49)
"}]
commit_message:
Update port_status to ACTIVE during live-migration

During live-migration nova waits for 'network-vif-plugged' event
in order to proceeed with live-migration [1]. While using OVN
it never happened because the original design assumes usage
of neutron agents.

This patch updates port status from DOWN to ACTIVE during
pre_live_migration state, which in fact for Neutron/ML2
is done by neutron-ovs-agent, just only to emit
'network-vif-plugged' notification and allow nova
to perform live-migration.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/558001/

Change-Id: Ib9fe6e1bfea1d5f62b2f2b6fdb12d16878108c3f
Related-Bug: 1834045
(cherry picked from commit 229f894ee6aff6b5da8cc399575537feed1c6a49)

commit_message:
Update tempest jobs

This updates the tempest jobs ran by Zuul. Work items:

* Renamed existing tempest jobs to be more explicit about which storage driver
  they're using.

* Introduced two new tempest jobs using the SQLAlchmey v1 storage driver,
  one with python2 and one with python3.

Change-Id: I6e30fa6a2dfab322d33fed7ec09cc4fcf9b73858

commit_message:
Fix NovaEnableRbdBackend to be role specific

This [1] change enabled to have role specific NovaEnableRbdBackend
parameter, however global parameter were allways overriding role
specific hiera after it was set via RoleParametersValue

[1]: I9f40a2a3561fcb1d1fec9d9c3c1f9cabaf02650c

Change-Id: Iab58223a6140e42028d4d2a7305c05fd7ae3a9f0
(cherry picked from commit eb5251ad9ff37f203eccdeba896b8386df1cb082)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-29 08:18:35.000000000', 'message': 'Increase number of retries in _process_trunk_subport_bindings

In patch [1] as partial fix for bug 1828375 retries mechanism
was proposed.
We noticed that sometimes in have loaded environments 3 retries
defined in [1] can be not enough.
So this patch switches to use neutron_lib.db.api.MAX_RETRIES constant
as number of retries when processing trunk subport bindings.
This MAX_RETRIES constant is set to 20 and in our cases it "fixed"
problem.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662236/

Change-Id: I016ef3d7ccbb89b68d4a3d509162b3046a9c2f98
Related-Bug: #1828375
(cherry picked from commit d1f8888843c53c1c4b95c2fd22b2b6ee97feb238)
'}]
commit_message:
Increase number of retries in _process_trunk_subport_bindings

In patch [1] as partial fix for bug 1828375 retries mechanism
was proposed.
We noticed that sometimes in have loaded environments 3 retries
defined in [1] can be not enough.
So this patch switches to use neutron_lib.db.api.MAX_RETRIES constant
as number of retries when processing trunk subport bindings.
This MAX_RETRIES constant is set to 20 and in our cases it "fixed"
problem.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662236/

Change-Id: I016ef3d7ccbb89b68d4a3d509162b3046a9c2f98
Related-Bug: #1828375
(cherry picked from commit d1f8888843c53c1c4b95c2fd22b2b6ee97feb238)

commit_message:
Remove deployed-server related stack output

The DeployedServerEnvironment output has been removed from the stack
as they are no longer needed when using config-download with
pre-provisioned nodes.

Change-Id: If94997621ebd1096326ba77a167564a728102b54

commit_message:
Adds tls_priority parameter to nova::compute::libvirt

Override the compile time default TLS priority string. The
default is usually "NORMAL" unless overridden at build time.
Only set this if it is desired for libvirt to deviate from
the global default settings.

Conflicts:
      manifests/compute/libvirt.pp

Change-Id: I221d48ba720e8ad820050fb5f735cd20d75f2f7a
Related-Bug: #1840447
(cherry picked from commit 7f9c58f86cb4c7505fa04f0ad7e723ada09034ba)
(cherry picked from commit b28b01a01f940af2356d348cf66d2dcdfa8ef25a)
(cherry picked from commit ef1499a4c6e7fe986bbf84158a7abfc2169613fc)

subject: Copy deployments.yaml to top level config-dir
messages: [{'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-08-28 22:03:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-08-29 12:45:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-28 22:03:33.000000000', 'message': "Copy deployments.yaml to top level config-dir

The deployments.yaml tasks file is not specific to roles, it's the same
for all. Moving it to the top level config-dir directory will allow
parallelizing these tasks across all roles instead of doing the roles
one by one.

For the time being, it's also copied to the existing location under the
role specific dir for backwards compatibility so that this patch can
merge without initially breaking tripleo-heat-templates. See the related
tripleo-heat-templates patch:
I83a4deaa68d5788edb5ab13652bb30c762f337d8

Change-Id: I839ca7f95688a992e82c670e190c82659951e34d
(cherry picked from commit fd8c629eaccf16e4d4c46feb9a6bb81205c1298a)
"}]
commit_message:
Copy deployments.yaml to top level config-dir

The deployments.yaml tasks file is not specific to roles, it's the same
for all. Moving it to the top level config-dir directory will allow
parallelizing these tasks across all roles instead of doing the roles
one by one.

For the time being, it's also copied to the existing location under the
role specific dir for backwards compatibility so that this patch can
merge without initially breaking tripleo-heat-templates. See the related
tripleo-heat-templates patch:
I83a4deaa68d5788edb5ab13652bb30c762f337d8

Change-Id: I839ca7f95688a992e82c670e190c82659951e34d
(cherry picked from commit fd8c629eaccf16e4d4c46feb9a6bb81205c1298a)

subject: Remove HostPrepConfig (for config-download)
messages: [{'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-08-28 21:48:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2019-08-28 23:43:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2019-08-29 12:41:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-28 21:48:51.000000000', 'message': "Remove HostPrepConfig (for config-download)

HostPrepConfig was using the old way (Heat) to run Ansible. We don't
need it anymore when using config-download.

This is an equivalent backport of
I2041e6892de76b0ed04d7497e3f9064bfaf58270 (why the same change-id is
used here). That patch can not just be backported as-is to stable/queens
because the non-config-download mechanism still needs to work, so we can
not just remove the resources.

Instead, we provide a new mapping that is set to OS::Heat::None when
config-download is activated with the environment file.

Change-Id: I2041e6892de76b0ed04d7497e3f9064bfaf58270
"}, {'created': '2019-08-28 23:43:31.000000000', 'message': "Remove HostPrepConfig (for config-download)

Change-Id: I2041e6892de76b0ed04d7497e3f9064bfaf58270

commit_message:
Remove HostPrepConfig (for config-download)

HostPrepConfig was using the old way (Heat) to run Ansible. We don't
need it anymore when using config-download.

This is an equivalent backport of
I2041e6892de76b0ed04d7497e3f9064bfaf58270 (why the same change-id is
used here). That patch can not just be backported as-is to stable/queens
because the non-config-download mechanism still needs to work, so we can
not just remove the resources.

Instead, we provide a new mapping that is set to OS::Heat::None when
config-download is activated with the environment file.

Change-Id: I2041e6892de76b0ed04d7497e3f9064bfaf58270

commit_message:
PDF documentation build

The document is simple enough, so 'howto' is specified as
documentclass instead of 'manual' as most projects do.

Change-Id: Iea024acb205b1045369367bdbf8e800793fedd2f
Story: 2006099

[{'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2019-08-20 17:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2019-08-20 19:02:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Please don't merge this yet"}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2019-08-21 20:08:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 6737, 'date': '2019-08-29 12:33:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

lgtm, rodrigo has tested all the scenarios i can think of to verify the patch is good so im happy for this to land.'}, {'account_id': 2424, 'date': '2019-08-29 14:34:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

lgtm, thanks rodrigo.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2019-08-29 14:38:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2019-08-29 14:38:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-20 17:09:35.000000000', 'message': "Prevent unnecessary nova-compute restarts on ceph_changed

Function 'is_broker_action_done' should return False when it
finds a response from ceph broker not marked done, in order
to trigger a nova restart. However, it also returns False if
there is no response data from ceph broker, triggering an
unecessary restart.

The function 'ceph_changed' is invoked under different remote
unit contexts when there are updates to the relation. When
querying the broker response, only the context of the remote
unit that is the broker can see the response, unless
specifically queried for that given unit.

The 'ceph_changed' invocations under a remote context that
are not the broker end up returning False in
'is_broker_action_done' and causing restarts, even after
the action is already marked done. This also happens on
'config-changed' hooks.

To fix this problem, the logic is now changed have each
'ceph_changed' invocation loop through units and process
the broker response, regardless of remote context.

This is an initial change to address the issue locally
in nova-compute charm. A later change will be worked on
to move the new helper methods to charmhelpers,
refactoring the existing ones there.

Change-Id: I2b41f8b252f4ccb68830e90c5e68456e15372bcf
Closes-bug: #1835045
(cherry picked from commit b1701e1b3174dcb06c05684319d6c73d6b2f509c)
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent unnecessary nova-compute restarts on ceph_changed

Function 'is_broker_action_done' should return False when it
finds a response from ceph broker not marked done, in order
to trigger a nova restart. However, it also returns False if
there is no response data from ceph broker, triggering an
unecessary restart.

The function 'ceph_changed' is invoked under different remote
unit contexts when there are updates to the relation. When
querying the broker response, only the context of the remote
unit that is the broker can see the response, unless
specifically queried for that given unit.

The 'ceph_changed' invocations under a remote context that
are not the broker end up returning False in
'is_broker_action_done' and causing restarts, even after
the action is already marked done. This also happens on
'config-changed' hooks.

To fix this problem, the logic is now changed have each
'ceph_changed' invocation loop through units and process
the broker response, regardless of remote context.

This is an initial change to address the issue locally
in nova-compute charm. A later change will be worked on
to move the new helper methods to charmhelpers,
refactoring the existing ones there.

Change-Id: I2b41f8b252f4ccb68830e90c5e68456e15372bcf
Closes-bug: #1835045
(cherry picked from commit b1701e1b3174dcb06c05684319d6c73d6b2f509c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-28 12:17:16.000000000', 'message': 'Fix mismatches of discovered/fixed/unique container names

When redeploying in-place, containers for the "fixed" service name can
be already existing, so new ones would get the prefixed names. That
might create mismatches, like bug 1839929. Thereas pidfile names in the
produced systemd unit and that passed to conmon contain different
values: the "fixed" (predictable) container service name vs its
prefixed unique name.

Fix that by using the discovered or unique names instead of the service
container names for the builder's container_run_args, cont_exec_args
and basic paunch actions, like run or exec.  This is achieved via the
delegate parameter used for tracking the real (discovered) container
name (a delegate) representing its corresponding fixed container name.

For podman builder, we use that delegate for conmon pidfile and logging
setup. So that now it always matches the PIDFile specified in the
systemd unit generated for that container.

For docker builder, we have no special uses for delegates, but we
support that parameter to simplify the code around (so that there will
be no need to wrap things with 'if cli == podman else...').

To fix the discovery of the container names for different run/exec
actions, make discover_container_name returning None, if the ps command
failed or returned nothing useful:

* For 'run', if no container name has been discovered, use its
  fixed/service container name. Then do not attempt inspecting
  or stopping such a container by its fixed/service name as it's
  proved as non existing in the system. That saves compute
  resources of the host and produces less confusing logs.

  Also, recreate the removed container under the same
  recently discovered name, or start a new one and give it the
  pre-generated unique name.

* For 'exec', raise an error if no name has been discovered for the
  fixed/service container. Do not use additional checks as the
  missing discover_container_name() data already provides information
  we need to know about the subject container.

Related-Bug: #1839929
Related-Bug: #1840992

Change-Id: Ia5277a3a29c78eac8b8da952ecf89b5aea59d9d2
Co-Authored-By: Cédric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix mismatches of discovered/fixed/unique container names

When redeploying in-place, containers for the "fixed" service name can
be already existing, so new ones would get the prefixed names. That
might create mismatches, like bug 1839929. Thereas pidfile names in the
produced systemd unit and that passed to conmon contain different
values: the "fixed" (predictable) container service name vs its
prefixed unique name.

Fix that by using the discovered or unique names instead of the service
container names for the builder's container_run_args, cont_exec_args
and basic paunch actions, like run or exec.  This is achieved via the
delegate parameter used for tracking the real (discovered) container
name (a delegate) representing its corresponding fixed container name.

For podman builder, we use that delegate for conmon pidfile and logging
setup. So that now it always matches the PIDFile specified in the
systemd unit generated for that container.

For docker builder, we have no special uses for delegates, but we
support that parameter to simplify the code around (so that there will
be no need to wrap things with 'if cli == podman else...').

To fix the discovery of the container names for different run/exec
actions, make discover_container_name returning None, if the ps command
failed or returned nothing useful:

* For 'run', if no container name has been discovered, use its
  fixed/service container name. Then do not attempt inspecting
  or stopping such a container by its fixed/service name as it's
  proved as non existing in the system. That saves compute
  resources of the host and produces less confusing logs.

  Also, recreate the removed container under the same
  recently discovered name, or start a new one and give it the
  pre-generated unique name.

* For 'exec', raise an error if no name has been discovered for the
  fixed/service container. Do not use additional checks as the
  missing discover_container_name() data already provides information
  we need to know about the subject container.

Related-Bug: #1839929
Related-Bug: #1840992

Change-Id: Ia5277a3a29c78eac8b8da952ecf89b5aea59d9d2
Co-Authored-By: Cédric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Retry "netns.ns_pids()" to avoid ENOENT

If during the namespace PIDs retrieval, one of those namespaces is
deleted, the Pyroute2 method "netns.ns_pids()" will return a ENOENT
error.

While the issue [1] is not solved, this retry method will avoid this
possible clash.

[1] https://github.com/svinota/pyroute2/issues/633

Change-Id: I7a2342dfd25e36dea564fa38475f80179d758ca2
Related-Bug: #1841753

commit_message:
Fill "driver_name" field in Deployable object

Currently, driver_name is not filled correctly. In this patch, I
have modified FPGA driver and report driver_name in DriverDeployable,
which permit to write this field in Cyborg DB.

Change-Id: I30acbe9f9c10e41993bfb77a9b5e3e8bf5d2a6fc

commit_message:
Microversion 2.77: Support Specifying AZ to unshelve

This patch adds a new parameter ``--availability-zone`` to ``nova
unshelve`` command. This can help users to specify an ``availability_zone``
to unshelve a shelve offloaded server from 2.77 microversion.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663851/
Implements: blueprint support-specifying-az-when-restore-shelved-server

Change-Id: I8bce8f430bc54f03bacc105e37fc8b3bbf2432c2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-27 16:06:41.000000000', 'message': "Increase size of cinder LVM backend

Increase the size of the cinder LVM backend to 20GB, and re-enable
tempest tests that were previously skipped due to space limitation.

Tempest's volume tests don't actually need 20GB of storage, but rapidly
creating and deleting volumes in a short time span may cause cinder's
scheduler to report a reduced amount of free space. The actual amount
of space in use is updated by the cinder-volume service, but this is
done periodically. Increasing the size of the LVM backend allows the
scheduler to sustain a burst of volume creation requests during the
time interval between updates from the volume service on the actual
amount of storage in use.

Closes-Bug: #1841071
Change-Id: Ie02211f3a6706f6fa1102fb8dc5ee0e9e54252cc
"}]
commit_message:
Increase size of cinder LVM backend

Increase the size of the cinder LVM backend to 20GB, and re-enable
tempest tests that were previously skipped due to space limitation.

Tempest's volume tests don't actually need 20GB of storage, but rapidly
creating and deleting volumes in a short time span may cause cinder's
scheduler to report a reduced amount of free space. The actual amount
of space in use is updated by the cinder-volume service, but this is
done periodically. Increasing the size of the LVM backend allows the
scheduler to sustain a burst of volume creation requests during the
time interval between updates from the volume service on the actual
amount of storage in use.

Closes-Bug: #1841071
Change-Id: Ie02211f3a6706f6fa1102fb8dc5ee0e9e54252cc

but

Are we really doing this? IIUC the github links are going to be retained forever. Is there some community drive to change all of them?'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-08-19 17:45:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/677185/2 : SUCCESS in 3h 05m 08s'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-08-19 20:08:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2019-08-19 20:13:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

> Are we really doing this? IIUC the github links are going to be retained forever. Is there some community drive to change all of them?

There's not a community drive I'm aware of, but I think it's a good idea for a few reasons:

1. Linking to GitHub promotes the myth that it's an authoritative source for OpenStack, whereas it's only a convenience mirror.

2. Linking to opendev.org promotes the visibility of the OpenDev project.

3. Free Software needs Free Tools, and GitHub is not free.  Here are a couple of excellent talks on this, both from previous summits, although I'm probably preaching to the choir here ;-)

- https://www.openstack.org/videos/summits/vancouver-2018/free-software-needs-free-tools
- https://www.openstack.org/videos/summits/denver-2019/open-source-is-not-enough

Cc'ing one or two TC folks to get their take on whether I'm barking up the right tree here.  Maybe it *should* be a (small) community goal at some point."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-19 20:58:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Yeah, fair enough.

I'll wait for a TCer or two to weigh in before +2ing"}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-08-19 22:00:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-35402 : FAILURE in 1h 23m 43s'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-08-19 22:14:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

I am of course in favor of using opendev.org URLs wherever feasible, and welcome the possibility that our developers will maybe think for a moment longer than they used to about the URLs they embed in documentation or even casual conversation, especially with regard to what their choice of URL may implicitly communicate to others about the OpenStack community's stance on the necessity of software freedom.

My only (relatively minor) misgiving is that this could start a new flood of folks keyword-searching every repository we have looking for an easy thousand or so patches they can push to improve their contributor statistics... but in the end I guess we and they still get something out of that exchange too."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-08-19 22:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-19 22:17:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Oh, yeah, I totally assumed Adam was just stat padding.

(kidding)'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-08-19 22:21:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Oh, also, if we're going to talk about doing these as a community goal, I'd prefer we mitigate the patch volume somewhat by lumping in other updates like correcting review.openstack.org URLs to review.opendev.org, updating the myriad of old addresses in documentation for mailing lists which were folded into openstack-discuss, and so on."}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2019-08-20 00:02:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-08-20 02:09:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-08-29 11:03:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Switch some GitHub URLs to point to opendev.org

Also update some outdated URLs at the same time, e.g. defcore is now
interop.

Unfortunately unlike GitHub, gitea doesn't yet support URLs with
shortened SHA1s; however this is being worked on:

    https://github.com/go-gitea/gitea/issues/6450

Change-Id: I6e6b63619f1138cc961b61be548453361d01f73c

[{'created': '2018-03-27 01:28:46.000000000', 'message': 'rbd: use MAX_AVAIL stat for reporting bytes available

Change-Id: I96faff6d3b9747514441d83c629fdd1cface1eb5
'}, {'created': '2019-06-19 20:35:28.000000000', 'message': "rbd: use MAX_AVAIL stat for reporting bytes available

Currently, the reporting of bytes available works well for recommended
Ceph deployments that run one OSD per disk [1]. However, for users who
are running multiple OSDs on a single disk, the current reporting will
reflect bytes available * number of replicas.

We can enhance the bytes available reporting method to accomodate
unrecommended Ceph deployments by using the MAX_AVAIL stat obtainable
via the 'ceph df' command. The MAX_AVAIL stat takes the number of
configured replicas into consideration and will reflect the correct
number of bytes available even when Ceph is deployed in a way the
documentation recommends against.

For most users, this change should make no difference. It will only be
a help for users who are running unrecommended Ceph deployments.

[1] http://docs.ceph.com/docs/luminous/start/hardware-recommendations/#hard-disk-drives

Change-Id: I96faff6d3b9747514441d83c629fdd1cface1eb5
"}]
commit_message:
rbd: use MAX_AVAIL stat for reporting bytes available

Currently, the reporting of bytes available works well for recommended
Ceph deployments that run one OSD per disk [1]. However, for users who
are running multiple OSDs on a single disk, the current reporting will
reflect bytes available * number of replicas.

We can enhance the bytes available reporting method to accomodate
unrecommended Ceph deployments by using the MAX_AVAIL stat obtainable
via the 'ceph df' command. The MAX_AVAIL stat takes the number of
configured replicas into consideration and will reflect the correct
number of bytes available even when Ceph is deployed in a way the
documentation recommends against.

For most users, this change should make no difference. It will only be
a help for users who are running unrecommended Ceph deployments.

[1] http://docs.ceph.com/docs/luminous/start/hardware-recommendations/#hard-disk-drives

Change-Id: I96faff6d3b9747514441d83c629fdd1cface1eb5

commit_message:
Add a "Caveats" section to the eventlet profiling docs

There are some bits of wisdom and workarounds required to have a
positive experience when profiling in an eventlet environment.

This patch adds a section where such wisdom can accumlate, and
also provides a workaround for a specific problem when profiling
nova-compute.

Change-Id: Id6362f20c831c43e4d3316fe573e28c6b891d459

commit_message:
Support keypair in devstack

Since Trove already supports to specify a Nova keypair when creating
instance for management convenience, devstack needs to be changed to
create the management keypair and add to Trove config file.

One extra change in this patch is to use a single config file for Trove
API, task-manager and conductor.

Change-Id: I1e6c4f4305104815bdf89b31776a4955de61bc89
Story: 2005429
Task: 30463

commit_message:
Enhancement to cell v2 doc with split for stein/train

In train we'll add a new tripleoclient command to help with
export stack data which is required for the cell stack input.

Also this change adds a basic and an advanced cell deployment
architecture. Due to release specific features the doc is split
into in different parts (stein,train and cell management)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/672070
Change-Id: Ia14e01f7f8deb55a6ac4f1b30a84352822143c27

[{'created': '2019-08-13 17:40:27.000000000', 'message': "Cache host to cell mapping in HostManager

If the instances per host are not cached in the HostManager
we lookup the HostMapping per candidate compute node during
each scheduling request to get the CellMapping so we can target
that cell database to pull the instance uuids on the given host.

For example, if placement returned 20 compute node allocation
candidates and we don't have the instances cached for any of those,
we'll do 20 queries to the API DB to get host mappings.

lookup for a given host and then after that, get the CellMapping
from the cells cache (which is a dict, keyed by cell uuid, to the

(cherry picked from commit 3a69fdb333e80f5ad2e025a9823b11483fad55c2)
