commit_message:
Cache host to cell mapping in HostManager

If the instances per host are not cached in the HostManager
we lookup the HostMapping per candidate compute node during
each scheduling request to get the CellMapping so we can target
that cell database to pull the instance uuids on the given host.

For example, if placement returned 20 compute node allocation
candidates and we don't have the instances cached for any of those,
we'll do 20 queries to the API DB to get host mappings.

We can improve this by caching the host to cell uuid after the first
lookup for a given host and then after that, get the CellMapping
from the cells cache (which is a dict, keyed by cell uuid, to the
CellMapping for that cell).

Change-Id: Ic6b1edfad2e384eb32c6942edc522ee301123cbc
Related-Bug: #1737465
(cherry picked from commit 3a69fdb333e80f5ad2e025a9823b11483fad55c2)

commit_message:
Convert HostMapping.cells to a dict

This changes the HostMapping.cells list to a dict,
keyed by cell uuid, to each CellMapping object.
This is going to be used in a later change [1] where
we will create a cached mapping of host to cell uuid
so we can go quickly from compute node host value to
get the CellMapping without having to lookup the
HostMapping again.

[1] Ic6b1edfad2e384eb32c6942edc522ee301123cbc

Change-Id: I75e5bf2c45688f68eeca27404641f4c438b023c6
Related-Bug: #1737465
(cherry picked from commit 426a303ee4cb848e75b9ed2acc498479c651c539)

HostManager.get_all_host_states method and the

'}]
commit_message:
Delete unused get_all_host_states method

The CachingScheduler was the last thing to use the
HostManager.get_all_host_states method and the
CachingScheduler was deleted in Stein [1].

This removes the unused get_all_host_states method.
The majority of the change is in the test code that
was using get_all_host_states as an entry point to
test the _get_host_states method, so rather than
outright delete the tests and potentially drop coverage
on _get_host_states, those tests are refactored a bit
to call _get_host_states directly.

[1] I1832da2190be5ef2b04953938860a56a43e8cddf

Change-Id: Ie19f1be2d60d4d20fac99508d1683ab3f266bfba
(cherry picked from commit d7ba0d0dba4c9b2c5fa72d55b38d58f6db2ee891)

commit_message:
Set undercloud-connection to local by default

This patch fixes the right default for the 'undercloud-connection' option
according to the help message.

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Jose Luis Franco <jfrancoa@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib0eb19ddd2968ab328565dec3171f480327be27f

commit_message:
Pass undercloud_connection in TripleoInventory instantiation.

The parameter undercloud_connection is being available as
an input option in the script, however it was not being passed
into the TripleoInventory object instantiation.

Change-Id: Ife819b1d807946c8e53deaacbb8e4f9361009f6e
Closes-Bug: #1832932

commit_message:
Support connecting to RabbitMQ with TLS

A side effect of the implementation is system installation of CA
certificate from the RabbitMQ relation.

This incidentally allows gss OpenStack clients to connect to API
endpoints in a Vault TLS enabled deployment, as the Vault CA is
announced over the RabbitMQ relation.

Change-Id: I4317b5db112546c34b561f6c743e83504dda8694
Closes-Bug: #1841553

I'm generally -1 on this as I think it's probably the wrong approach. revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-16 10:48:43.000000000', 'message': 'Strip venv from PATH when subprocessing external python

Whenever we subprocess out from the charm, it is most likely because
we are running tools provided by the payload to mange it.

We should take care to remove the venv from path whenever there is a
chance for external python tools to be directly or indirectly
involved.

Change-Id: Icce4e4a8475b6ad3dc9bf60e59ff2a8ee60d9d1c
Closes-Bug: #1840257
'}, {'created': '2019-08-19 14:42:07.000000000', 'message': 'Override PATH in subprocess env for external Python

Whenever we subprocess out from the charm, it is most likely because
we are running tools provided by the payload to mange it.

We should take care to set an appropriate path whenever there is a
chance for external python tools to be directly or indirectly
involved.

Change-Id: Icce4e4a8475b6ad3dc9bf60e59ff2a8ee60d9d1c
Closes-Bug: #1840257
'}, {'created': '2019-08-19 14:50:59.000000000', 'message': 'Override PATH in subprocess env for external Python

Whenever we subprocess out from the charm, it is most likely because
we are running tools provided by the payload to mange it.

We should take care to set an appropriate path whenever there is a
chance for external python tools to be directly or indirectly
involved.

commit_message:
Override subprocess environment for dpkg

Whenever we subprocess out from the charm, it is most likely because
we are running tools provided by the payload to mange it.

We should take care to set an appropriate environment whenever there
is a chance for external python tools to be directly or indirectly
involved.

Change-Id: Icce4e4a8475b6ad3dc9bf60e59ff2a8ee60d9d1c
Closes-Bug: #1840257

commit_message:
Set provisioning and cleaning networks as non-shared

Modifies provisioning and cleaning networks in multi-tenant ironic
environments to be non-shared. Flat networks remain shared.

To apply the change to an existing environment, run 'kayobe overcloud
post configure'.

Change-Id: Ie59f0c729381e5bea112ab7f5d0c738a9488b772
Story: 2006409
Task: 36295
(cherry picked from commit f91cf43876afa967bcf26c133c7973f84f02341f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-23 15:23:25.000000000', 'message': 'doc: remove confusing docs about aggregate allocation ratios

Change Ifaf596a8572637f843f47daf5adce394b0365676 added a note
about the behavior change in Ocata where allocation ratios
set on host aggregates was ignored because of placement resource
provider allocation ratios being used.

Later, change I7d8e822cd40dccaf5244e2cd95fa1af43fa9ed87 added
a lot more detail about allocation ratios in the scheduler docs
including the initial* allocation ratio config options. The note
from the previous change was moved and as a result leads to some
confusion since the doc starts by saying essentially, "you can
use these aggregate filters to manage allocation ratios on a set
of hosts" and then the immediate note says essentially, "oh btw
that doesn't work since ocata, sorry!".

To avoid the confusion, this simply removes the part about how
the aggregate filters can be used to manage allocation ratios.

Conflicts:
      doc/source/admin/configuration/schedulers.rst

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I8a0d332877fbb9794700081e7954f2501b7e7c09 in Stein.

Change-Id: I62710b0b8c098cca3f67020f4a6da5e684115414
Related-Bug: #1804125
(cherry picked from commit 77efc084fc50d38d2a1b42aca864a2a56eae6eba)
'}]
commit_message:
doc: remove confusing docs about aggregate allocation ratios

Change Ifaf596a8572637f843f47daf5adce394b0365676 added a note
about the behavior change in Ocata where allocation ratios
set on host aggregates was ignored because of placement resource
provider allocation ratios being used.

Later, change I7d8e822cd40dccaf5244e2cd95fa1af43fa9ed87 added
a lot more detail about allocation ratios in the scheduler docs
including the initial* allocation ratio config options. The note
from the previous change was moved and as a result leads to some
confusion since the doc starts by saying essentially, "you can
use these aggregate filters to manage allocation ratios on a set
of hosts" and then the immediate note says essentially, "oh btw
that doesn't work since ocata, sorry!".

To avoid the confusion, this simply removes the part about how
the aggregate filters can be used to manage allocation ratios.

Conflicts:
      doc/source/admin/configuration/schedulers.rst

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I8a0d332877fbb9794700081e7954f2501b7e7c09 in Stein.

Change-Id: I62710b0b8c098cca3f67020f4a6da5e684115414
Related-Bug: #1804125
(cherry picked from commit 77efc084fc50d38d2a1b42aca864a2a56eae6eba)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-04 03:00:40.000000000', 'message': 'Uncap jsonschema

We have jsonschema capped at a fairly old version. Other than some
specific releases, it looks like keeping it below 3.0 was added in
I943fd68b9fab3bce1764305a5058df5339470757 without really any explanation
why.

In order to update to a 3.x release we need to:
1. Remove the cap from global-requirements.txt (see Depends-On), leaving
   upper-constraints.txt at a 2.x release
2. Remove the cap from all consumers (this change)
3. Release a new version of consumers that are published to pypi
4. Update upper-constraints.txt with those new releases
5. Update jsonschema in upper-constraints.txt to a 3.X release
   (See: https://review.openstack.org/649789)
6. Test consumers with the change from 5.
7. [Optional] fix issues in consumers that arise from 6.
8. Merge the change from 5.

Change-Id: I193b71b0ee6fe1abffa0d6aa30ddb1412daf6da0
Co-Authored-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/649669

commit_message:
Uncap jsonschema

We have jsonschema capped at a fairly old version. Other than some
specific releases, it looks like keeping it below 3.0 was added in
I943fd68b9fab3bce1764305a5058df5339470757 without really any explanation
why.

In order to update to a 3.x release we need to:
1. Remove the cap from global-requirements.txt (see Depends-On), leaving
   upper-constraints.txt at a 2.x release
2. Remove the cap from all consumers (this change)
3. Release a new version of consumers that are published to pypi
4. Update upper-constraints.txt with those new releases
5. Update jsonschema in upper-constraints.txt to a 3.X release
   (See: https://review.openstack.org/649789)
6. Test consumers with the change from 5.
7. [Optional] fix issues in consumers that arise from 6.
8. Merge the change from 5.

Change-Id: I193b71b0ee6fe1abffa0d6aa30ddb1412daf6da0
Co-Authored-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/649669

commit_message:
Pass undercloud's private key to inventory used in package_update.

As the Ansible playbook is being executed from the mistral_executor
container, we need to establish a conection to the Undercloud via ssh
not local as it was being done up to now. In order to be able to ssh
into the host we need to provide with the tripleo-ansible's user ssh
key.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677777/

Closes-Bug: #1832932
Change-Id: I20948d49b3023dc76acff8779bbe182886e55838

(cherry picked from commit 28a3d020618f633608de2657a8589c32fe44a964)

commit_message:
Create pike-eol tag for all TripleO projects

TripleO Team is no longer accepting patches to
stable/pike branch, this patch proposes to create pike-eol
tags for all TripleO projects.

Change-Id: I62acc422bb7e0c61dfb780358bedb551c2d9825f
Signed-off-by: Chandan kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
[docs] Be more specific about pip command

As osa cli supports only python3, we should be more specific about
it's installation command.

Change-Id: Ief18b1bdbe05889baf98ae1e8adadb367fd88bbf

commit_message:
Zadara VPSA: Support volume multiattach

Use 'Force' flag when attaching volume to a server. It will allow
it to be attached to more servers.
Handle multiple detach attempts from the same host (assuming
volume is attached to instances reside on the same compute node)

Change-Id: I2a61ff31cf33f5baaa79f63412d7b9e226f546ba

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-27 16:00:58.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for uploading local image

The current python image uploader only supports uploading an image from
a remote source to a repository. Since customers my have a custom image
locally and want to push it to an undercloud repository (non-docker
based), we need to expose a way to upload a local image to an undercloud
repository. This change adjusts the upload function to check if the
source image is local because it is prefixed with containers-storage:
rather than docker:// or no prefix.

Change-Id: Ie4f34f668bdb32395187662566d917e799249444
Related-Blueprint: podman-support
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for uploading local image

The current python image uploader only supports uploading an image from
a remote source to a repository. Since customers my have a custom image
locally and want to push it to an undercloud repository (non-docker
based), we need to expose a way to upload a local image to an undercloud
repository. This change adjusts the upload function to check if the
source image is local because it is prefixed with containers-storage:
rather than docker:// or no prefix.

Change-Id: Ie4f34f668bdb32395187662566d917e799249444
Related-Blueprint: podman-support

commit_message:
Increase number of retries in _process_trunk_subport_bindings

In patch [1] as partial fix for bug 1828375 retries mechanism
was proposed.
We noticed that sometimes in have loaded environments 3 retries
defined in [1] can be not enough.
So this patch switches to use neutron_lib.db.api.MAX_RETRIES constant
as number of retries when processing trunk subport bindings.
This MAX_RETRIES constant is set to 20 and in our cases it "fixed"
problem.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662236/

Change-Id: I016ef3d7ccbb89b68d4a3d509162b3046a9c2f98
Related-Bug: #1828375

are expected to behave with the policies API.

A subsequent patches will -

 - add functionality for system reader for policy association
 - add functionality for system member for policy association
 - add functionality for system admin for policy association
 - domains user test coverage for policy association
 - project user test coverage for policy association
 - Removing obsolete policies in policy.v3cloudsample.json file

Partial-Bug: #1805409
'}]
commit_message:
Add tests for project users interacting with policies

This commit introduces some tests that show how project users
are expected to behave with the policies API.

A subsequent patches will -

 - add functionality for system reader for policy association
 - add functionality for system member for policy association
 - add functionality for system admin for policy association
 - domains user test coverage for policy association
 - project user test coverage for policy association
 - Removing obsolete policies in policy.v3cloudsample.json file

Change-Id: Ia234baf3cd361ef62e7ed59885ca9b1a610eaaa0
Partial-Bug: #1805409

commit_message:
Select proper flavor_ref_alt for Tempest

Currently if user selects the default instance type for Tempest
tests, some of resize-related tests may fail due to resize attempt
into flavor with smaller disk size. It is because there is just
simple check if flavor_ref and flavor_ref_alt (IDs) aren't the same.
To ensure resize is really possible, there shall be additional
verification introduced.

Co-Authored-By: Michał Madarasz <michal.madarasz@corp.ovh.com>
Change-Id: Iaa1bfa9cb76cbe54be658d2d70d97d99e7fb5be9

commit_message:
Revert "Handle defined containers that are stopped."

It is causing some containers (memcached) to be re-created at
every run, with the unique name. We need to rework the code
as well as it's breaking pacemaker-managed containers.
This reverts commit 85fb2ed4d3f7e42840842f2bdec617e33d6ba4ef.

Change-Id: I22d3eb35dced8178fe6beb0c76c855746efdf94d
(cherry picked from commit bd400ccd815b0b787f3bc8d2ac18a45463ba695b)

commit_message:
Blacklist python-cinderclient 4.0.0

This release of the Cinder client broke support for the v3
volume-transfer APIs unless microversion 3.55 or higher was requested.
depend on https://review.opendev.org/#/c/587877/

Change-Id: I794c12459c59c02ad92e66bc2e8836500a08eef9

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-27 15:54:07.000000000', 'message': 'watcher: add systemd units for watcher services

Currently systemd unit for watcher componenets are missing making it
difficult to manage the lifecycle of these services.
So adding these unit files and be installed during installation.

commit_message:
watcher: add systemd units for watcher services

Currently systemd unit for watcher componenets are missing making it
difficult to manage the lifecycle of these services.
So adding these unit files and be installed during installation.

Also a minor tweak to the permission of the service folder under
sysconf dir to enable reading of the service config files for
these processes.

Change-Id: Id35d7e39429bdf13be95d414481ec6eaf7fce874
(cherry picked from commit 0e1f66123ef2a840e2f7b316fbb6c3577e7b72c1)

commit_message:
Revert "Handle defined containers that are stopped."

The proposed solution breaks pacemaker-managed containers,
see bz#1745950.

FWIW this only fix a corner case where the operators stopped the containers and want to run a tripleo operation
e.g. major upgrade.

We are proposing a revert to unblock downstream and
we'll have to rework this patch.

This reverts commit 85fb2ed4d3f7e42840842f2bdec617e33d6ba4ef.

Change-Id: I8a27b92498d832698ba4d55bed1b2adcf2c1e3eb

'}, {'created': '2019-08-24 03:33:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fixing query_client failing with IPv6

* Change query_client to use rsplit to split ip
  to make sure we can handle IPv6 addresses.

* Strip brackets from ip address to make sure dig

Change-Id: I2619fab9eb7e35579566cac70e2e718dae474be0
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing query_client failing with IPv6

* Change query_client to use rsplit to split ip
  to make sure we can handle IPv6 addresses.

* Strip brackets from ip address to make sure dig
  does not fail if the IPv6 is uri formatted.

Change-Id: I2619fab9eb7e35579566cac70e2e718dae474be0

commit_message:
Adds support force delete for NS

This patch adds '--force' parameter to NS delete command,
to force delete NS instances.
e.g: openstack ns delete test_ns --force

blueprint force-delete-resources

Change-Id: I739ad1e1e764f38edffa3d7fa423da370b53242b

library code, but it isn't needed anyhow since

subject: Fix idempotency on RHEL8
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-28 15:01:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix idempotency on RHEL8

On RHEL8, podman is shipped by default with podman-docker which installs
an alias so the operators can still use "docker" CLI, but the command
will be converted to run "podman" instead:

  Emulate Docker CLI using podman. Create /etc/containers/nodocker to quiet msg

We don't want to remove the rpm or create /etc/containers/nodocker so
the operators have the warning and now we are moving to Podman by
default.

So we need to change Paunch to detect if Docker was actually running
before removing docker-managed containers, instead of using 'which
docker', we'll check for the actual docker socket if it exists.

Co-Authored-By: Cédric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I628c2fe7e962412f0d7e1c3e044d02c5a2fabd77
(cherry picked from commit 2ed3e83fdefb965ca62234a1657fc95dc6a27e99)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix idempotency on RHEL8

On RHEL8, podman is shipped by default with podman-docker which installs
an alias so the operators can still use "docker" CLI, but the command
will be converted to run "podman" instead:

  Emulate Docker CLI using podman. Create /etc/containers/nodocker to quiet msg

We don't want to remove the rpm or create /etc/containers/nodocker so
the operators have the warning and now we are moving to Podman by
default.

So we need to change Paunch to detect if Docker was actually running
before removing docker-managed containers, instead of using 'which
docker', we'll check for the actual docker socket if it exists.

Co-Authored-By: Cédric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I628c2fe7e962412f0d7e1c3e044d02c5a2fabd77
(cherry picked from commit 2ed3e83fdefb965ca62234a1657fc95dc6a27e99)

These were used by the Ceph Ansible/Mistral code, but since it is no
longer in Mistral we don't need these actions. They are currently
unused.

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-24 17:42:21.000000000', 'message': 'Delay HA router transition from "backup" to "master"

As described in the bug, when a HA router transitions from "master" to
"backup", "keepalived" processes will set the virtual IP in all other
HA routers. Each HA router will then advert it and "keepalived" will
decide, according to a trivial algorithm (higher interface IP), which
one should be "master". At this point, the other "keepalived" processes
running in the other servers, will remove the HA router virtual IP
assigned an instant before

To avoid transitioning some routers form "backup" to "master" and then
to "backup" in a very short period, this patch delays the "backup" to
"master" transition, waiting for a possible new "backup" state. If
during the waiting period (set to the HA VRRP advert time, 2 seconds
default) to set the HA state to "master", the L3 agent receives a new
"backup" HA state, the L3 agent does nothing.

Closes-Bug: #1837635

Change-Id: I70037da9cdd0f8448e0af8dd96b4e3f5de5728ad

commit_message:
Delay HA router transition from "backup" to "master"

As described in the bug, when a HA router transitions from "master" to
"backup", "keepalived" processes will set the virtual IP in all other
HA routers. Each HA router will then advert it and "keepalived" will
decide, according to a trivial algorithm (higher interface IP), which
one should be "master". At this point, the other "keepalived" processes
running in the other servers, will remove the HA router virtual IP
assigned an instant before

To avoid transitioning some routers form "backup" to "master" and then
to "backup" in a very short period, this patch delays the "backup" to
"master" transition, waiting for a possible new "backup" state. If
during the waiting period (set to the HA VRRP advert time, 2 seconds
default) to set the HA state to "master", the L3 agent receives a new
"backup" HA state, the L3 agent does nothing.

Closes-Bug: #1837635

Change-Id: I70037da9cdd0f8448e0af8dd96b4e3f5de5728ad

subject: Use internal endpoint lookups for selenium helm tests
messages: [{'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2019-08-28 20:08:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2019-08-28 20:56:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2019-08-29 01:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-28 20:08:37.000000000', 'message': 'Use internal endpoint lookups for selenium helm tests

This updates the grafana and nagios helm test pod templates to
use the internal endpoints for their selenium tests instead of the
public endpoints when defined

commit_message:
Use internal endpoint lookups for selenium helm tests

This updates the grafana and nagios helm test pod templates to
use the internal endpoints for their selenium tests instead of the
public endpoints when defined

Change-Id: I1138cb29a808894d3339bc1b07c3a60804b9546f
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

commit_message:
Adds tls_priority parameter to nova::compute::libvirt

Override the compile time default TLS priority string. The
default is usually "NORMAL" unless overridden at build time.
Only set this if it is desired for libvirt to deviate from
the global default settings.

Change-Id: I221d48ba720e8ad820050fb5f735cd20d75f2f7a
Related-Bug: #1840447
(cherry picked from commit 7f9c58f86cb4c7505fa04f0ad7e723ada09034ba)
(cherry picked from commit b28b01a01f940af2356d348cf66d2dcdfa8ef25a)

(10 comments)

Thanks for this important commit. In general, I agree with the idea and I would like to add it as soon as possible. However, I've noticed some elements which can be improved. 
Also, it seems you didn't create any new tests for it. Such a complicated new feature definitely need a test or two :)"}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-02-20 01:54:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-02-20 01:55:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-02-20 01:58:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

(9 comments)

> (10 comments)
 > 
 > Thanks for this important commit. In general, I agree with the idea
 > and I would like to add it as soon as possible. However, I've
 > noticed some elements which can be improved.
 > Also, it seems you didn't create any new tests for it. Such a
 > complicated new feature definitely need a test or two :)

Hi Dariusz, thanks for the review. Actually I am waiting for some input about this patch to make sure I'm on the right direction before I spend too much time on the unit test, at least make sure the code won't break any existing test.

I added WIP in the commit message and will work on the tests soon."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-02-20 10:31:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2019-02-22 15:01:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

(11 comments)

Lingxian, the feature you proposed is very interesting and in my opinion very valuable for the project since it implements the practical production use-case. I added some initial questions to better understand your ideas and prepare for intelligent discussion in the future.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-02-25 03:55:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15: Workflow-1

guys, i will break down this patch into smaller ones so it's much easier to move things forward."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-02-25 05:33:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

Hi guys, after re-checking the whole implementation, there is one thing that I haven't tested before but found it's stopping us from making the database instance only visible to the admin user. 

If the end user specifies `--nic port-id=xxx`, the whole design doesn't work because Nova doesn't allow the admin user to create VM using the user's port.

I don't know if it's appropriate to only support net-id for creating db instance in Trove? Do you already have the use case that needs to specify the port-id?"}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-02-25 05:33:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

@Bartosz, @Dariusz'}, {'account_id': 29393, 'date': '2019-02-26 15:14:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

As far as I remember we were using net-id and v4-fixed-ip when creating trove instances. I cannot recall using port-id :/'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-02-26 20:08:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

> As far as I remember we were using net-id and v4-fixed-ip when
 > creating trove instances. I cannot recall using port-id :/

So, can we remove the support of port-id for instance creation in favor of putting the Nova VM in the admin tenant?'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-08-29 02:13:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
[WIP] Add default security groups for control plane ports

- Add new config option `default_mgmt_security_groups` for the trove
  management interfaces. The security groups for management interfaces
  need to be pre-created and configured by the cloud operator.
- Add new database table `ports` to store the ports created for the
  database VM. The ports will be deleted when the vm is deleted.
- The security group created for user-defined interface is visible to
  the user.

All the logic changes in this patch only takes effect when
`default_neutron_networks` is configured, Trove will assume Neutron is
available and create instance in the admin project.

Change-Id: I967814d08f3e9976e1d566c81a849093b42f43c3

commit_message:
Remove Ranger testing control from project-config

Currently Ranger is in the process of upgrading
to python 3.6. As part of this process we have
decided to remove control of checks and gates
from project-config so that we may more easily
manage and change gates and checks to suit
the project's needs.

Change-Id: I97bce06c1844da324c01371a094819cfbaf79e8c

commit_message:
Add uwsgi role to gerritbot

While adding uwsgi role to projects, change to gerritbot wasn't made.
This patch aims to fix this so that gerritbot monitor repo and post
updates to the appropriate IRC channel.

commit_message:
Excludes tables and search on PDF version

PDF version on I18n Contributor Guide does not have to
include so detail tables which rendered version looks awkward.

This patch excludes the tables on PDF version and search tab by
using ".. only:: html" directive, and notes to link a corresponding
HTML page by using ".. only:: latex" directive.

Change-Id: I7b1b9d2d5d8c21827fe5a261f06f38d30b2d3709

commit_message:
fix: 'openstack-tox-docs' gate

The 'openstack-tox-docs' gate is currently broken:
`html_static_path entry '_static' does not exist`

Removed the 'html_static_path' from 'doc/source/conf.py' as this is
also how Tempest is configured [0]

[0] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/doc/source/conf.py#L125

Change-Id: I1244457428cbefb9341a1991839d41b592b6c469

'}]
commit_message:
Adding file uri support for ipa image location

Allow ipa kernel/disk images to be specified via file:// designator
so they can be locally hosted in addition to being available over
http.

Change-Id: If3e32f30a7df27113721e15bff9ecaae16bfe8d4

commit_message:
Add rabbitmq statefulset name to Armada chart overrides

This adds the rabbitmq statefulset name override to the values
for each openstack service chart in the Armada manifest, as this
is required to support communicating with the rabbitmq backends
directly

Change-Id: I4a2fabf491c6607bec80f37a8d1236c55ec8430a
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

subject: Clear net.ifnames definition
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 18575, 'name': 'Saravanan KR', 'email': 'krsacme@gmail.com', 'username': 'saravanankr'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23618, 'name': 'Christophe Fontaine', 'email': 'cfontain@redhat.com', 'username': 'christophefontaine'}, {'_account_id': 23811, 'name': 'Oliver Walsh', 'email': 'owalsh@redhat.com', 'username': 'owalsh'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-08-26 14:50:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23618, 'date': '2019-08-26 14:56:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-08-26 15:04:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-08-26 15:04:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2019-08-26 16:03:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This will fail on upgrade as leapp requires persistent name'}, {'account_id': 23618, 'date': '2019-08-26 16:14:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> This will fail on upgrade as leapp requires persistent name

Do you suggest to set biosdevname or to remove completely the cmdline parameter ?

With the value actually present (ifnames=0), this will set a different name between RHEL7 (emX) and RHEL8 (ethX), which will fail on upgrade as well.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-08-26 18:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

net.ifnames=
           Network interfaces are renamed to give them predictable names when possible. It is enabled by default; specifying 0 disables it.'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2019-08-26 18:46:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

If I understand correctly, setting net.ifnames specifically will override the biosdevname setting. To make it explicitly clear what is happening, I think we should set biosdevname=0 and net.ifnames=1. For background, biosdevname will create names like p1p2, and net.ifnames will create names like enp1s12. The problem with the pXpX-style names is that they can be reordered if the hardware changes (such as installing a new NIC card). Predictable net names (net.ifnames) is more stable when hardware changes.

The biggest problem I see with this for upgrades is if a system was using biosdevname=1 and then we change to biosdevname=0 and net.ifnames=1. I know we have deployments using biosdevname today. We should probably provide a parameter for each setting to provide complete control.'}, {'account_id': 23618, 'date': '2019-08-26 18:50:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

This patch restores the expected behaviour (and "default" that we have in RHEL7) which is to keep the predictable names.
As of today, we are just blind as the names are eth0, eth1, etc.

For customers who have biosdevname enabled, isn't this a manual parameter they added to the command line ?'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2019-08-26 20:01:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Christophe, whether users took manual action to enable biosdevname is a good question. I only know that I've seen plenty of TripleO user environments where the pXpX naming was in use, but I never figured out why."}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2019-08-27 06:56:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

It would be good to know the reason behind disabling net.ifnames by default to the base image. And for TripleO, since we are maintaining the upgrade compatibility, it would apt to keep the same behavior.

By that, I mean removing it altogether, and leaving to the default enabled in the systemd-udevd service, rather than adding confusion of why its been added from stein on wards.'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2019-08-27 11:50:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

+1 for having an upgrade path for various configurations. However i have to admit i'm thoroughly confused by this and failing to find good info.

So if net.ifnames is not default in RHEL 8, what is the default? Is it biosdevname? Or is it the old eth0, eth1 namings? commit_message:
Clear net.ifnames definition

With RHEL8, net.ifnames is set to 0 in the grub config. This is a change
in the default image which can have user impacts. We want to clear it to
go back to the previously defined behavior in RHEL7.

Change-Id: I621066ea5e0e934668ff4c91e991a95d18e019f7
Closes-Bug: #1841441

commit_message:
Add To and Subject headers to all E-mail templates

Our election results announcement templates had headers for To and
Subject, but the bulk of our E-mail templates had neither. Update
the existing ones to reflect the transition from the openstack-dev
ML to openstack-discuss, and add appropriate headers to all other
templates lacking them.

Change-Id: Ic606143e1deb7d669f09e26cdfbe0a2bce103ad3

commit_message:
Update templates for the project structure reform

We haven't had "programs" since the 2014-12-02 OpenStack project
structure reform specification was approved by the OpenStack TC.
Update the terminology in our templates accordingly.

commit_message:
Remove token_endpoint auth type

The token_endpoint was a compatibility auth type to maintain support
for the --url global option that dated back to the beginning of
OpenStack CLI auth.  The common keystoneauth library implements
'admin_token' which provides the same functionality using
--endpoint rather than --url.

Change-Id: I1b9fbb96e447889a41b705324725a2ffc8ecfd9f
Signed-off-by: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update api-ref

The API that adjutant implements is called Admin-Logic, so update index
file for it.

Since we only publish api-ref documents when they are changed, make this
change dependend on the job that adds the api-ref documentation.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/679071
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/675766
Change-Id: I62729a0dfb40815c0e6ac2647f0681565ed3cc8a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-21 16:42:21.000000000', 'message': "Add 'compressed' option to container_format

This patch is purposed to support a new container_format
so that we can do image compression when uploading a volume
to glance and decompression when downloading a image from
glance.

This patch includes:

1. A new container_format option: 'compressed'.

2. Unit test for new option.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670454/
Change-Id: I62159315346e99522740383dd4bb5d2cc0ee368d
Implements: blueprint leverage-compression-accelerator
"}, {'created': '2019-08-26 08:07:49.000000000', 'message': "Add 'compressed' option to container_format

commit_message:
Add 'compressed' option to container_format

This patch is purposed to support a new container_format
so that we can do image compression when uploading a volume
to glance and decompression when downloading a image from
glance.

This patch includes:

1. A new container_format option: 'compressed'.

2. Unit test for new option.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint leverage-compression-accelerator

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/670454/
Change-Id: I62159315346e99522740383dd4bb5d2cc0ee368d

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2019-08-14 14:12:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Out of curiosity, what value do the pod release uuid annotations add here, as the pods spun up for jobs are meant to be ephemeral?  We've only ever added the release uuid annotations to the job metadata."}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2019-08-14 14:27:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> Out of curiosity, what value do the pod release uuid annotations
 > add here, as the pods spun up for jobs are meant to be ephemeral? 
 > We've only ever added the release uuid annotations to the job
 > metadata.

Thank you for review @Steve. I may not have the entire picture, but as a request from @Anand we have to have release_uuid for every pod spawned by deployment. Somehow I expected those pods to be deleted at the end of the deployment, but at least in our lab they stay in place, and when we do select all pods to figure out if we have to delete them, those are left in place due to lack of uuid field. With release_uuid in place, we can dispose them in the same fashion as the rest of pods."}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2019-08-14 14:34:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16274, 'date': '2019-08-16 15:02:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Add release uuid to pods

This PS adds the ability to attach a release uuid to pods objects.

Implements: Ability to attach release_uuid to ephemeral pods

commit_message:
Revert "Fix mismatching fixed vs unique container names"

This reverts commit 5d174c1bea474a34da6f4f68173323a8243c4fc5.
This commit didn't help to fix the bug originally reported.
Also it brings more complexity in how we manage containers,
we want to roll-back and do not change the behaviors now.

Change-Id: I1fd76970ee4168f4d4457bbd9da524565dfc0680

commit_message:
Revert "Optimize container CLI for getting unique names"

This reverts commit a6df749249b36d2c4aa1621892e778eb9d8248ab.
This commit didn't help to fix the bug originally reported.
Also it brings more complexity in how we manage containers,
we want to roll-back and do not change the behaviors now.

Change-Id: I87c20690b2e1081c126c672892b8b28f03fa7227
Related-Bug: #1839559

commit_message:
builder: ensure we have a correct name for the container

This patch adds a validation at the beginning of the builder, to make
sure the container name is the fixed one (e.g. keystone) and not the
unique one with the suffix. It'll help to 1) fail earlier if the
container name is wrong when the builder is called and 2) to debug more
easily if it happens with an error message before the next steps in the
builder.

Co-Authored-By: Cédric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ibd29430e4eece190fb99ac34cb5a07de841cfa80

'}]
commit_message:
Adds new "--no-inflight-validations" option to deploy CLI

This provides an independant way to activate or not the in-flight
validations within a deploy.
The default is to have them running, and this option allows to
deactivate the in-flight ones.

Change-Id: I81e934e2978cad4e2713d54e19a57c84a6ac0b52

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-22 17:32:17.000000000', 'message': 'WIP - introduce container_running() and use it before running podman exec

container_running is a new method which will allow to return True if a
container is detected as running or False if not running.
There is a retry mechanism which if "podman ps" is used, will add "--sync" to
the command so we synchronize the state of OCI runtime.

It will be first used by the builder when a container is configured to
run "podman exec"; we'll first verify that the container exist otherwise
return an error.

TODO:
- figure out if we need a sleep in the while between each iterations (in ms)
- more unit tests?

Co-Authored-By: Cédric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1839559
Change-Id: If4d8c268218bf83abed877a699fc583fb55ccbed
(cherry picked from commit 7b78c2c5125b0271200f40627276ff52d02a67fa)
'}, {'created': '2019-08-22 19:10:19.000000000', 'message': 'WIP - introduce container_running() and use it before running podman exec

commit_message:
Check if container is running before doing an exec

container_running is a new method which will allow to return True if a
container is detected as running or False if not running.
There is a retry mechanism which if "podman ps" is used, will add "--sync" to
the command so we synchronize the state of OCI runtime. Before doing a
"podman ps", we try to check if the service is running in systemd.
There is a very short sleep between the retries to give a chance to
podman to find the container if it takes a bit of time to start or seen
as started.

It will be used by the builder when a container is configured to
run "podman exec"; we'll first verify that the container exist otherwise
return an error and stop the deployment.

This patch is mainly a workaround against a race condition where in
heavy-loaded environments, an exec can be run too early in a step where
the container is still starting.

It also consolidate the discover_container_name method in order to get
more chance to actually get a name.

Co-Authored-By: Cédric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1839559
Change-Id: If4d8c268218bf83abed877a699fc583fb55ccbed
(cherry picked from commit 983ab98f61f530eec7cac31e3a0556bf6722e2a0)

[{'created': '2019-08-28 14:23:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix idempotency on RHEL8

On RHEL8, podman is shipped by default with podman-docker which installs
an alias so the operators can still use "docker" CLI, but the command
will be converted to run "podman" instead:

  Emulate Docker CLI using podman. Create /etc/containers/nodocker to quiet msg

We don't want to remove the rpm or create /etc/containers/nodocker so
the operators have the warning and now we are moving to Podman by
default.

So we need to change Paunch to detect if Docker was actually running
before removing docker-managed containers, instead of using 'which
docker', we'll check for the actual docker socket if it exists.

Co-Authored-By: Cédric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I628c2fe7e962412f0d7e1c3e044d02c5a2fabd77
'}]
commit_message:
Fix idempotency on RHEL8

On RHEL8, podman is shipped by default with podman-docker which installs
an alias so the operators can still use "docker" CLI, but the command
will be converted to run "podman" instead:

  Emulate Docker CLI using podman. Create /etc/containers/nodocker to quiet msg

We don't want to remove the rpm or create /etc/containers/nodocker so
the operators have the warning and now we are moving to Podman by
default.

So we need to change Paunch to detect if Docker was actually running
before removing docker-managed containers, instead of using 'which
docker', we'll check for the actual docker socket if it exists.

Co-Authored-By: Cédric Jeanneret <cjeanner@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I628c2fe7e962412f0d7e1c3e044d02c5a2fabd77

commit_message:
Use /var/tmp on host to store temporal files for image upload via Horizon

Previously we use /tmp inside horizon container to store temporal files
for image upload via Horizon, but this makes the image size grow for
each upload operation.

This patch makes sure that we use host directory to store temporal
file, so that it is not written inside container.

Change-Id: Ic32e7a2db83bb5a0fb3c69708be9be96435dd030
Closes-Bug: 1840607

commit_message:
Ensure SG is only deleted in case it's present in the KuryrNet CRD

In case Namespace Isolation is not enforced no SG is created and
added to the KuryrNet CRD. Right now, when an exception occurred
on the KuryrNet CRD addition, we try to delete a SG that was not
created.
This commit fixes the issue by checking for the existence of the
sgID in the CRD pior to deleting it.

Change-Id: I4ad3886398138d9a4a8e483b66b3573200002a0c
Closes-Bug: 1841765

commit_message:
Add undercloud-key-file and ssh_network options.

To enable the execution via ssh into the Undercloud node it's
required to pass also the ansible_ssh_user private key. This
options is part of the tripleo_common inventory.py, but defaults
to None.
This patch allows to pass this parameter in case it's needed.

Also, this patch allows to pass a different value for the host_network
parameter in TripleoInventory instantiation. Setting it by default to
ctlplane.

Change-Id: Id303f356c1b06906aa5aae43b0032bb80a712508
Related-Bug: #1832932
(cherry picked from commit db30779959c78208b39e716c946152ae8f7e904c)

subject: Pass neutron-ovs.yaml environment in upgrade prepare.
messages: [{'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2019-08-28 10:01:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 21537, 'date': '2019-08-28 10:03:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2019-08-28 15:02:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-28 10:01:26.000000000', 'message': 'Pass neutron-ovs.yaml environment in upgrade prepare.

If the environmet is deployed in Rocky with OVS then we need to pass
the neutron-ovs.yml environment file for the upgrade prepare and converge
steps to work. Otherwise, as OVN is the Neutron engine by default in
Stein it will try to deploy with OVN and the upgrade will fail.

Also, the containers-prepare-parameter.yaml is shared between the UC
and the OC upgrade. For the case of the UC, there is no possibility to
deploy with ovn, so we force the neutron_driver option (defaulted to ovn
when creating the default containers-prepare-parameter.yaml file) to
openvswitch. However, for the OC, we need to identify if it was deployed
with the OVN service enabled and if so, set the netron_driver to ovn instead.

In summary, we first upgrade from Rocky with OVS to Stein with OVS and
if required, a post-upgrade step to upgrade from OVS to OVN would be
performed. In the case the Rocky deployment was with OVN enabled we
perform a Rocky with OVN to Stein with OVN upgrade.

Change-Id: I21bbf9cda977a1c269e2c1caad4bf88d3f6173b0
(cherry picked from commit bb44ee55a3057540ffd05a4b55f8ccff9294f3e0)
'}]
commit_message:
Pass neutron-ovs.yaml environment in upgrade prepare.

If the environmet is deployed in Rocky with OVS then we need to pass
the neutron-ovs.yml environment file for the upgrade prepare and converge
steps to work. Otherwise, as OVN is the Neutron engine by default in
Stein it will try to deploy with OVN and the upgrade will fail.

Also, the containers-prepare-parameter.yaml is shared between the UC
and the OC upgrade. For the case of the UC, there is no possibility to
deploy with ovn, so we force the neutron_driver option (defaulted to ovn
when creating the default containers-prepare-parameter.yaml file) to
openvswitch. However, for the OC, we need to identify if it was deployed
with the OVN service enabled and if so, set the netron_driver to ovn instead.

In summary, we first upgrade from Rocky with OVS to Stein with OVS and
if required, a post-upgrade step to upgrade from OVS to OVN would be
performed. In the case the Rocky deployment was with OVN enabled we
perform a Rocky with OVN to Stein with OVN upgrade.

Change-Id: I21bbf9cda977a1c269e2c1caad4bf88d3f6173b0
(cherry picked from commit bb44ee55a3057540ffd05a4b55f8ccff9294f3e0)

subject: Do request_log middleware next to last
messages:
[{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-26 17:53:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-26 20:16:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Not sure what's going on with the unit test. This works in real life [1]. A little help?

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/27/673027/1/check/grenade-py3/05edfb5/logs/screen-placement-api.txt.gz#_Jul_26_18_26_15_252477"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-26 20:22:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-07-29 12:39:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The comment before the stack is bit out of date and probably needs to be cleaned up. The ordering is weird and you can't really discern what comes "next" from just that stack because each wsgi middleware has an inward (what it does in __call__) and outward (what it does in a replacement_start_response) side to its activity.

The oslo middleware req_id writes the request id into the environ on the inward side.

The request log middleware has two logs: a debug log that it writes when it starts the request and the "real" log it writes when it is done (the one with the size in it). It's the first one that's dying in the test which means that when it was in the location it had been in, something else was surreptitiously cooking the environ to set remote addr  and we just happened to be benefitting from it.

In the call to 'blank' you can pass a stub environ:

    blank(path, environ=None, base_url=None, headers=None, POST=None, **kw)

so that ought to get you past this but it would interesting to know which middleware was cooking things (because it probably shouldn't).

You're probably right about moving the logger, but all the above was to provide context to make sure that you're moving it in the way you think you're moving it.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-29 15:59:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-07-29 16:12:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I'll fup with a clarification on the NOTE near the chunk that's change here. There are some details that are wrong and the concept is not explained as well as it could be."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-07-29 16:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

actually need to think about it more'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-07-29 16:35:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-29 17:50:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-09 16:45:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1 Workflow-1

You're absolutely right, Tetsuro. In all the confusion in this patch I lost sight of the actual problem that started it off. And at this point the commit message is plain wrong in claiming that the headers are now emitted when logging.

Here's the recreate:

- Apply https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672984/
- Make a gabbi test fail, e.g.

 --- a/placement/tests/functional/gabbits/allocation-candidates.yaml
 +++ b/placement/tests/functional/gabbits/allocation-candidates.yaml
 @@ -33,7 +33,7 @@ tests:
  
  - name: get allocation candidates no resources
    GET: /allocation_candidates
 -  status: 400
 +  status: 401
    response_strings:
        - "'resources' is a required property"
 
- Run the gabbi test, e.g.

 tox -e functional-py36 -- get_allocation_candidates_no_resources

- Before and after this patch (at PS3) the 'x-openstack-request-id' header is absent.
- Reversing the order of req_id_middleware and request_log makes it appear.

The catch here is that we want to log as late as possible on *both* the inbound and outbound paths, because we want the logs to show things in a state as close as possible to what the application receives, and also as close as possible to what's sent back out over the wire.

Do we need to split request_log into two, an 'inbound' and 'outbound', so we can position each where it needs to go?'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-09 16:54:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

What about: subclass the request id middleware and incorporate the requestlog functionality into it, leaving behind one piece of middleware, called 'request'?

that piece would be the outermost middleware meaning that on the inbound side it would get the request-id as early as possible and write a "we're starting a new request" DEBUG line. And on the outbound it would do the "we've finished a request" INFO line.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-09 16:58:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

It sounds like an interesting idea, but my head is exploding trying to grok the implications of where and how to call what via super().

I'll look into it later when my head isn't so fuzzy."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-08-16 16:22:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> It sounds like an interesting idea, but my head is exploding trying
 > to grok the implications of where and how to call what via super().
 > 
 > I'll look into it later when my head isn't so fuzzy.

I gave it a shot at https://review.opendev.org/#/c/676982/

Not quite as tidy as I was hoping, but we may be able to rescue it. Feel free to mess with it while I'm away."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-28 21:08:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

in favor of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/676982/'}]

emitted:

         ('openstack-api-version', 'placement 1.8'),

It turns out we were hitting the request_log middleware before the

possible to what's going to be sent across the wire. So this commit

         ('x-openstack-request-id', 'req-99385d48-0860-48ff-a4a4-a2423153f0f2')]

commit_message:
Do request_log middleware next to last

While trying to track down a global_request_id problem, I added some
debug logging into RequestLog [1] but the x-openstack-request-id was not
emitted:

headers: [('Content-Length', '162'),
         ('Content-Type', 'application/json'),
         ('openstack-api-version', 'placement 1.8'),
         ('vary', 'openstack-api-version')]

It turns out the request_log middleware and req_id_middleware were not
interacting well. We need to establish the request id, from incoming
headers, first, then as soon as we can, start logging. Then we want the
final log to be as near the end of the request as possible.

Even though we don't (currently) log headers under normal circumstances,
the logger should have a crack at the request in a form as close as
possible to what's going to be sent across the wire. So this commit
moves request_log to next to last in the chain.

After this change, the above becomes:

headers: [('Content-Length', '162'),
         ('Content-Type', 'application/json'),
         ('openstack-api-version', 'placement 1.8'),
         ('vary', 'openstack-api-version'),
         ('x-openstack-request-id', 'req-99385d48-0860-48ff-a4a4-a2423153f0f2')]

Note that reordering broke an unrelated test that was expecting
environ['REMOTE_ADDR'], which isn't set in the "blank" Request being
used, so this is addressed as well.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/672984/

Change-Id: I5a80056dd88836a4e79a649fa02d36dc7e75eee4

commit_message:
Uncap kombu

The related bug was fixed in eventlet 0.25.1, so we can now uncap kombu,
reverting [1], and instead blacklist eventlet 0.25.0. The latter was
done by [2]; this commit does the former.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677070/
[2] I39ed2c57015fcd291868e20fe2f3b657aa8f4eb3

Change-Id: I9b314283434791d808984a810508dc028484ba5d
Related-Bug: #1840551

Mock out writing of bash-completion cache files
during unit tests.

Related-Bug: #1817782

commit_message:
Increase loadbalancer timeout

The L7 router is taking longer than the current defined timeout
to be created. This commit increases the timeout.


Change-Id: Ie593aa04c387dd9c94c4ea9212c023add3e2feee

commit_message:
Ensure Pod IP is retrieved after pod is annoated with the VIF

When a pod takes a while to get annotated with the VIF information,
the retrieval of the pod IP from the annotations might fail due to
missing annotation, causing the controller to restart.
This commit fixes the issue by ensuring the pod IP is only retrieved
after the pod is annotated.

Change-Id: Iac1570b76783d532b77e7d8be96f2b71a19f8409
Closes-Bug: 1841758

Switched to the default scheduler temporarily to see if all tests pass with it.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-08-16 06:39:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2019-08-16 19:40:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Can you explain what do you mean in "avoid DB calls in some cases"? I can't see any logical fixes, just signature change'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2019-08-19 08:30:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Can you explain what do you mean in "avoid DB calls in some cases"?
 > I can't see any logical fixes, just signature change

Yes, sure. If you look at the default_scheduler.py you'll see that we now don't have to sum the result given from the in-memory jobs count and the jobs stored in the DB every time. Now, if we see that there are jobs in memory that satisfy the given criteria then we can return quicker. Practically, on some workflow, this reduced number of DB queries gives a serious different in performance (like I mentioned in the commit message). With the previous method signature we would have to count all jobs (in memory and in DB) every time.'}, {'account_id': 29124, 'date': '2019-08-19 13:24:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30755, 'date': '2019-08-25 06:50:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2019-08-26 08:40:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Change-Id: Ife48d9e464114fd60a08707d8f32f847a6f623c9
'}, {'created': '2019-08-15 10:18:44.000000000', 'message': 'Improve new scheduler

* Changed method get_scheduled_jobs_count() in the Scheduler
  interface to has_scheduled_jobs(). In fact, the callers
  always need to compare the number of jobs with 0, i.e.
  to see if there are any jobs or not. But more importantly,
  this semantics (returning just boolean) allows to make a
  good optimisation for DefaultScheduler and avoid DB calls
  in a number of cases. Practically, for example, it saves
  several seconds (5-6) if we run a workflow with 500 parallel
  no-op tasks that are all merged with one "join" task. Tested
  on 1 and 2 engines.
* Added test assertions for has_scheduled_jobs()
* Other minor chagnes

Change-Id: Ife48d9e464114fd60a08707d8f32f847a6f623c9

* Added test assertions for has_scheduled_jobs()
* Other minor chagnes

Change-Id: Ife48d9e464114fd60a08707d8f32f847a6f623c9

commit_message:
Improve new scheduler

* Changed method get_scheduled_jobs_count() in the Scheduler
  interface to has_scheduled_jobs(). In fact, the callers
  always need to compare the number of jobs with 0, i.e.
  to see if there are any jobs or not. But more importantly,
  this semantics (returning just boolean) allows to make a
  good optimisation for DefaultScheduler and avoid DB calls
  in a number of cases. Practically, for example, it saves
  several seconds (5-6) if we run a workflow with 500 parallel
  no-op tasks that are all merged with one "join" task. Tested
  on 1 and 2 engines.
* Added test assertions for has_scheduled_jobs()
* Other minor chagnes

Change-Id: Ife48d9e464114fd60a08707d8f32f847a6f623c9

Flag safe usage of sha1 w/ #nosec

This tells bandit that this usage of sha1 is not
interesting for security scans.

commit_message:
Delete redundant code

Method _discover_mpath_device isn't overwrited in FibreChannelConnector,
just use it by self._discover_mpath_device.

commit_message:
Set provisioning and cleaning networks as non-shared

Modifies provisioning and cleaning networks in multi-tenant ironic
environments to be non-shared. Flat networks remain shared.

To apply the change to an existing environment, run 'kayobe overcloud
post configure'.

Change-Id: Ie59f0c729381e5bea112ab7f5d0c738a9488b772
Story: 2006409
Task: 36295

commit_message:
Run kata static checks

These static checks run as part of the existing jenkins job [0] so we
add it to the new zuul job.

[0] https://github.com/kata-containers/tests/blob/master/.ci/jenkins_job_build.sh#L102-L104

Change-Id: I45d9eae77080828a81423e2874f23cb5a4af1b24

commit_message:
Fixing dn_to_id function for cases were id is not in the DN

The more common scenario to return the uid as part of the RDN in a DN,
However, it's a valid case to not have the uid in the RDN, so we need to
search in the LDAP based on the DN and return the uid in the entire object.

Also, we do not support multivalued attribute id on DN, so the test case
covering this case, it was adjusted for raise NotFound.

Closes-Bug: 1782922
Change-Id: I87a3bfa94b5907ce4c6b4eb8e124ec948b390bf2

Note if you move your job config in repo then you don't need the infra team to review these changes in the future."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-08-28 00:45:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15222, 'date': '2019-08-28 15:23:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks for your feedback and hint. I'm trying to add a .zuul.yaml file in our project, but for now, I'm unable to suppress the openstack-tox-python27 job either ways :-( I had read the doc you're pointing at me Andreas, but didn't find enough details on what I can do with that new conf file to be confortable with it, that's why I was attempting to change that in project-config instead.

My .zuul.yaml is now very small:
---
- project:
    templates:
      - check-requirements
    check:
      jobs:
        - openstack-tox-pep8

But still invokes the py27 job that are always failing for us.
Documented here: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678928/

If you have 5' to give me a hint on that, that would be very kind. I'll continue to search on my side of course anyway, and read again docs to find more hints I may have missed.

Thanks anyway for your help."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-08-28 15:26:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

first merge a change to remove everything *here*, then merge your change to add .zuul.yaml...

so, update this one - we merge it - and then you won't have py27 anymore"}, {'account_id': 15222, 'date': '2019-08-28 16:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15222, 'date': '2019-08-28 16:04:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-27 23:48:21.000000000', 'message': "Remove python 2.7 jobs for python-redfish

They do not work for us anymore because of incompatibilities with Sphinx
between python 3.x and python 2.x. As python 3.x is the way forward,
we'll just have the CI for it.

Change-Id: Idf857cb0e48ff4e7d4b283d7b203870c41e3fb67

commit_message:
Manages build reqs in python-redfish project

python-redfish can benefit from zuul v3 new feature allowing management
of build requiremetns into the project instead of centrally in
project-config. First step is to remove these build requiremetns from
it with this commit (except publish-to-pyi).

Change-Id: Idf857cb0e48ff4e7d4b283d7b203870c41e3fb67

commit_message:
Increase timeout for promote-openstack-manuals

openstack-manuals publishing takes a long time, it can run 1250 (fast)
or timeout (1803s), increase the timeout by 50 per cent.

Change-Id: I9312ae3a8345810337d16d929f396fbe2d4d5208

commit_message:
Honor blocking=True for the etcd aquire method

In the event that there is a spurious connectvity issue with the
etcd service, then the self.client.put opertaion will fail with
a RequestException. The will result in the current lock no longer
being a blocking operation.

This was a result of commit 1a57bbcc24021a6c237cad6a26f5035f0fc8fa92

Fixes-bug: #1841077
Change-Id: I6010d8d8e066ba0dec820c365bcbf2e2dd93a685

The proposed solution breaks pacemaker-managed containers,
see bz#1745950.

FWIW this only fix a corner case where the operators stopped the containers and want to run a tripleo operation
e.g. major upgrade.

We are proposing a revert to unblock downstream and
we'll have to rework this patch.

This reverts commit 85fb2ed4d3f7e42840842f2bdec617e33d6ba4ef.

Change-Id: I8a27b92498d832698ba4d55bed1b2adcf2c1e3eb
(cherry picked from commit e500ba926220039bc8709778285ef16dabfe2b96)
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Handle defined containers that are stopped."

The proposed solution breaks pacemaker-managed containers,
see bz#1745950.

FWIW this only fix a corner case where the operators stopped the containers and want to run a tripleo operation
e.g. major upgrade.

We are proposing a revert to unblock downstream and
we'll have to rework this patch.

This reverts commit 85fb2ed4d3f7e42840842f2bdec617e33d6ba4ef.

Change-Id: I8a27b92498d832698ba4d55bed1b2adcf2c1e3eb
(cherry picked from commit e500ba926220039bc8709778285ef16dabfe2b96)

commit_message:
Ensure controller is only restarted after the event timesout

It can take a while for a pod to have annotations and a hostIP
defined. It is also possible that a pod is deleted before
the state is set, causing a NotFound k8s exception. Lastly,
a service migth be missing the lbaas_spec annotation, causing
the event handled on the endpoints to crash. All this scenarios
can be avoided by raising a resource not ready exception, which
allows the operation to be retried.

Change-Id: I5476cd4261a6118dbb388d7238e83169439ffe0d

commit_message:
Add LibvirtTLSPriority to set libvirtd tls_priority

Adds LibvirtTLSPriority parameter to override the compile time
default TLS priority string.
Default: 'NORMAL:-VERS-SSL3.0:-VERS-TLS-ALL:+VERS-TLS1.2'

Conflicts:
      deployment/nova/nova-libvirt-container-puppet.yaml

Removed the conflict, as this file is not present in Queens
release and corresponding changes are done in
puppet/services/nova-libvirt.yaml file.

Change-Id: Id05c5e88be2d9f90642ed5159cb2db03c997f83a
Closes-Bug: #1840447
(cherry picked from commit 56ccd717d48aca2d3138c1f4416baa72d3655216)
(cherry picked from commit 393f43a664b16fe284b54c75320a2c7f09d18579)
(cherry picked from commit 9a31aafd33da991a9ea5d8b1cc70f6151ce06255)

In order to unblock removal of openshift Python library dependency, we
need a release of kuryr-tempest-plugin that will not use it. In order to
do that this commit switches its release model to
cycle-with-intermediary and creates a 0.5.0 release. More info can be

Change-Id: Iff90f2b643744b1dd63c8f15e1a72b879ee9a720

commit_message:
Release kuryr-tempest-plugin 0.5.0

In order to unblock removal of openshift Python library dependency, we
need a release of kuryr-tempest-plugin that will not use it. In order to
do that this commit switches its release model to
cycle-with-intermediary and creates a 0.5.0 release. More info can be
found on openstack-discuss [1]

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-August/008667.html

Change-Id: Iff90f2b643744b1dd63c8f15e1a72b879ee9a720

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-28 06:34:22.000000000', 'message': 'Allow the execution of leapp without RHSM subscription.

There are a set of workarounds which can be executed in order
skip the RHSM subscription requirement to run the Leapp tool. This
patch includes an option leapp_unsubscribed, a boolean, that when
setted to true enables an environment variable LEAPP_DEVEL_SKIP_RHSM
which skips the subscription check.

Change-Id: Ifca276dabad3c87f86681704d4fad0658c66f4b2
(cherry picked from commit 7866adeba05e6a843c5c5901d074f7953aa34e0c)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow the execution of leapp without RHSM subscription.

There are a set of workarounds which can be executed in order
skip the RHSM subscription requirement to run the Leapp tool. This
patch includes an option leapp_unsubscribed, a boolean, that when
setted to true enables an environment variable LEAPP_DEVEL_SKIP_RHSM
which skips the subscription check.

Change-Id: Ifca276dabad3c87f86681704d4fad0658c66f4b2
(cherry picked from commit 7866adeba05e6a843c5c5901d074f7953aa34e0c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-28 06:53:03.000000000', 'message': 'Set EnablePackageInstall to true by default for in-place OS upgrade

For in-place upgrades via Leapp, which is the default, we are
dependent on package installs. User can still override the default
value if they wish so, but they might have to pull in the content by
some manual means.

Change-Id: I5e5629d2baed97988bc65151d51c115a2a263dfc
Partial-Bug: #1831690
(cherry picked from commit 86d425601495550282119be035180bdbc71cfc57)
'}]
commit_message:
Set EnablePackageInstall to true by default for in-place OS upgrade

For in-place upgrades via Leapp, which is the default, we are
dependent on package installs. User can still override the default
value if they wish so, but they might have to pull in the content by
some manual means.

Change-Id: I5e5629d2baed97988bc65151d51c115a2a263dfc
Partial-Bug: #1831690
(cherry picked from commit 86d425601495550282119be035180bdbc71cfc57)

subject: [WIP][POC] Allow guest-agent get conf files via tftp
messages: [{'account_id': 25254, 'date': '2019-08-28 02:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25254, 'date': '2019-08-28 08:56:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25254, 'date': '2019-08-28 17:22:31.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-28 02:20:50.000000000', 'message': "[WIP][POC] Allow guest-agent get conf files via tftp

This patch will bring conf files from controller into instances.
We are needing to add TFTP_ENABLE=True during build guest images
through Diskimage-builder (DIB). It's a solution more secure than
SCP/SSh from controller.

Change-Id: I2cb0dd2906c77b86acb199133997922fed8c0c5e
"}, {'created': '2019-08-28 08:56:26.000000000', 'message': "[WIP][POC] Allow guest-agent get conf files via tftp

This patch will bring conf files from controller into instances.
We are needing to add TFTP_ENABLE=True during build guest images
through Diskimage-builder (DIB). It's a solution more secure than
SCP/SSh from controller.

Change-Id: I2cb0dd2906c77b86acb199133997922fed8c0c5e
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP][POC] Allow guest-agent get conf files via tftp

This patch will bring conf files from controller into instances.
We are needing to add TFTP_ENABLE=True during build guest images
through Diskimage-builder (DIB). It's a solution more secure than
SCP/SSh from controller.

Change-Id: I2cb0dd2906c77b86acb199133997922fed8c0c5e

commit_message:
Move some code out of utils.py

Move code into more specific locations where it is
applicable rather than the Cinder-wide utils.py.

Change-Id: I87f80f041cec255d51145e39bc0c0781a81e6db8

commit_message:
Handle already created objects in "test_update_timpestamp"

In [1], if the waiting loop is executed more than once, the previously
created objects should be deleted first to avoid the problem related in
[2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678262
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1841183/comments/3

Change-Id: I86cd17be6a776e4598abaeeb63de2eecbf0a64f9
Related-Bug: #1841183

commit_message:
Add LibvirtTLSPriority to set libvirtd tls_priority

Adds LibvirtTLSPriority parameter to override the compile time
default TLS priority string.
Default: 'NORMAL:-VERS-SSL3.0:-VERS-TLS-ALL:+VERS-TLS1.2'

Conflicts:
      deployment/nova/nova-libvirt-container-puppet.yaml

Removed the conflict, as this file is not present in Rocky
release and corresponding changes are done in
puppet/services/nova-libvirt.yaml file.

Change-Id: Id05c5e88be2d9f90642ed5159cb2db03c997f83a
Closes-Bug: #1840447
(cherry picked from commit 56ccd717d48aca2d3138c1f4416baa72d3655216)
(cherry picked from commit 393f43a664b16fe284b54c75320a2c7f09d18579)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-12 20:20:35.000000000', 'message': "Create supplemental node volume in correct volume pool

The tls_everywhere_provisioner.sh script creates the supplementatal
node but fails to create it in the libvirt volume pool. This mean the
idempotent check (below) fails.

- name: Check if the supplemental node volume already exists
  command: >
    virsh vol-info --pool '{{ libvirt_volume_pool }}'
    '{{ supplemental_node.name }}.qcow2'

And because virt-install creates a pool of it's choosing unknown to
oooq the pool is never cleaned up, a resource leakage.

This patch uses virsh to create the supplemental volume in the
libvirt_volume_pool where all the other node volumes are located and
then uses virsh again to upload the image into that
volume. virt-install will discover the disk image is already present
in a known pool and hence will not create a new pool.

Change-Id: Ie34233b7930badf41023635064286d2cdaab0b71
Closes-Bug: 1833456
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Create supplemental node volume in correct volume pool

The tls_everywhere_provisioner.sh script creates the supplementatal
node but fails to create it in the libvirt volume pool. This mean the
idempotent check (below) fails.

- name: Check if the supplemental node volume already exists
  command: >
    virsh vol-info --pool '{{ libvirt_volume_pool }}'
    '{{ supplemental_node.name }}.qcow2'

And because virt-install creates a pool of it's choosing unknown to
oooq the pool is never cleaned up, a resource leakage.

This patch uses virsh to create the supplemental volume in the
libvirt_volume_pool where all the other node volumes are located and
then uses virsh again to upload the image into that
volume. virt-install will discover the disk image is already present
in a known pool and hence will not create a new pool.

Change-Id: Ie34233b7930badf41023635064286d2cdaab0b71
Closes-Bug: 1833456
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add LibvirtTLSPriority to set libvirtd tls_priority

Adds LibvirtTLSPriority parameter to override the compile time
default TLS priority string.
Default: 'NORMAL:-VERS-SSL3.0:-VERS-TLS-ALL:+VERS-TLS1.2'

Change-Id: Id05c5e88be2d9f90642ed5159cb2db03c997f83a
Closes-Bug: #1840447
(cherry picked from commit 56ccd717d48aca2d3138c1f4416baa72d3655216)

[{'created': '2019-08-14 14:32:45.000000000', 'message': "Pass undercloud's private key to inventory used in package_update.

As the Ansible playbook is being executed from the mistral_executor
container, we need to establish a conection to the Undercloud via ssh
not local as it was being done up to now. In order to be able to ssh
into the host we need to provide with the tripleo-ansible's user ssh
key.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/676415/1

Closes-Bug: #1832932
Change-Id: I20948d49b3023dc76acff8779bbe182886e55838

commit_message:
Pass undercloud's private key to inventory used in package_update.

As the Ansible playbook is being executed from the mistral_executor
container, we need to establish a conection to the Undercloud via ssh
not local as it was being done up to now. In order to be able to ssh
into the host we need to provide with the tripleo-ansible's user ssh
key.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/676415/

Closes-Bug: #1832932
Change-Id: I20948d49b3023dc76acff8779bbe182886e55838

Novajoin is reliant on some notifications from nova. We recently merged
an update to the undercloud installation that disables the notification
drvier across the board if telemetry is disabled. This change adds a
service_config_setting for nova to force the notification driver to
messagingv2. This should be merged with the service configurations and
override the value that is normally set via NotificationDriver.

Change-Id: Ifee8f7f50fc2ef99605cbbcaa89016514b80b561

(cherry picked from commit 7c9c363c789811d54353d769aab86774eb5c96f8)

commit_message:
Explicitly set notification driver for novajoin

Novajoin is reliant on some notifications from nova. We recently merged
an update to the undercloud installation that disables the notification
drvier across the board if telemetry is disabled. This change adds a
service_config_setting for nova to force the notification driver to
messagingv2. This should be merged with the service configurations and
override the value that is normally set via NotificationDriver.

Change-Id: Ifee8f7f50fc2ef99605cbbcaa89016514b80b561
Closes-Bug: #1841100
(cherry picked from commit 7c9c363c789811d54353d769aab86774eb5c96f8)

commit_message:
Choose first node as bootstrap node name/ip

Previously when Heat was choosing the bootstrap node, it always chose
the first node due to the ResourceGroup ordering.

When it was switched to ansible, the last node was chosen instead due to
unpredictable dict sorting from the inventory.

This patch restores the previous behavior and makes sure the first node
in a group is chosen as the bootstrap node for the both the name
and ip if the sorted_bootstrap_node variable is set.

The variable is used so that the tripleo-heat-templates patch and this
patch can merge, otherwise they'd block each other from merging.

See I6b93f5b0747c5a11d24615a3bbb5516f9be81401 for the
tripleo-heat-templates patch.

Change-Id: I3d595ea5b84f940a3b2dbc69798f69fe03529c10

commit_message:
Update api-ref location

The api documentation is now published on docs.openstack.org instead
of developer.openstack.org. Update all links that are changed to the
new location.

Note that redirects will be set up as well but let's point now to the
new location.

For details, see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-July/007828.html

Change-Id: If2443f0aafc82e78c4adeea4bbf8d5fd60ad6e58

commit_message:
Remove 'hw:cpu_policy', 'hw:mem_page_size' extra specs from API samples

In a future change, the use of 'hw:cpu_policy' will require a host to
report PCPU inventory. Rather than modify the fake driver used in these
tests to report such inventory, just use a different extra spec,
'hw:numa_nodes'. This has the added bonus of being supported by both the
libvirt and Hyper-V virt drivers, unlike 'hw:cpu_policy' and
'hw:mem_page_size', which are only supported by the libvirt virt driver.

Change-Id: Id203dc07f08557b1b094ec72e1df3493ec9524b1
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
